items.name: S. B. No. 161
items.shorttitle: Designate Captain Michael Palumbo Memorial Highway
items.longtitle: To enact section 5534.491 of the Revised Code to designate a portion of I-271 in Cuyahoga County as the "Captain Michael Palumbo Memorial Highway."

items.name: H. B. No. 250
items.shorttitle: Establish requirements for using electric bicycles
items.longtitle: To amend sections 4501.01, 4509.01, 4511.01, 4511.27, 4511.39, 4511.40, 4511.52, 4511.53, 4511.54, 4511.55, 4511.56, 4511.68, and 4511.711 and to enact section 4511.522 of the Revised Code to establish requirements for the use of electric bicycles.

items.name: H. B. No. 101
items.shorttitle: Improve access to epinephrine
items.longtitle: To amend sections 3728.03, 4729.16, 4729.99, and 4731.96 and to enact sections 3707.60, 4729.382, 4729.46, and 4731.961 of the Revised Code to authorize an epinephrine autoinjector substitution when a prescription is filled or refilled, to authorize epinephrine to be dispensed without a prescription under a physician-established protocol, and to declare the act the "Epinephrine Accessibility Act."

items.name: S. B. No. 119
items.shorttitle: Address opioid prescribing and addiction treatment
items.longtitle: To amend sections 4715.302, 4729.75, 4729.77, 4729.79, 4731.052, and 4731.055 and to enact sections 4715.303, 4731.058, 4731.059, and 5119.373 of the Revised Code regarding addiction treatment and opioid prescribing by physicians and dentists.

items.name: H. B. No. 73
items.shorttitle: Prohibit selling dextromethorphan without Rx if under 18
items.longtitle: To enact section 2925.62 of the Revised Code to prohibit sales of dextromethorphan without a prescription to persons under age 18.
items.version: As Reported by the House Health Committee

items.name: H. B. No. 111
items.shorttitle: Authorize nurses to compel mental health evaluations
items.longtitle: To amend sections 5122.01 and 5122.10 of the Revised Code to authorize certain advanced practice registered nurses to have a person involuntarily transported to a hospital for a mental health examination.

items.name: H. B. No. 165
items.shorttitle: Designate Congenital Cytomegalovirus Awareness Month
items.longtitle: To enact section 5.2518 of the Revised Code to designate May as "Congenital Cytomegalovirus Awareness Month."

items.name: H. B. No. 49
items.shorttitle: Creates FY 2018-2019 operating budget
items.local_impact_statement: No - Not required for budget bills

items.name: S. B. No. 102
items.shorttitle: Address Clostridium difficile outbreaks in nursing homes
items.longtitle: To amend sections 3707.48, 3707.99, 3721.04, and 3721.99 and to enact sections 3707.061 and 3721.026 of the Revised Code regarding outbreaks of Clostridium difficile in nursing homes.

items.name: S. B. No. 143
items.shorttitle: Designate International Ataxia Awareness Day
items.longtitle: To enact section 5.257 of the Revised Code to designate September 25 as "International Ataxia Awareness Day" in Ohio.

items.name: S. B. No. 7
items.shorttitle: Know of protection order if actual knowledge
items.longtitle: To amend section 2919.27 of the Revised Code to provide the circumstances when service of a protection order or consent agreement upon a person is not necessary for the person to be convicted of the offense of violating a protection order.

items.name: S. B. No. 117
items.shorttitle: Designate Drive Ohio Byways Month
items.longtitle: To enact section 5.292 of the Revised Code to designate May as "Drive Ohio Byways Month."

items.name: S. B. No. 78
items.shorttitle: USAF Staff Sgt Yvonne Marie Fair Memorial Highway
items.longtitle: To enact section 5534.45 of the Revised Code to designate a portion of State Route 7 in Jefferson County as the "U.S. Air Force Staff Sergeant Yvonne Marie Fair Memorial Highway."

items.name: S. B. No. 77
items.shorttitle: Create KylerStrong Foundation license plate
items.longtitle: To amend section 4501.21 and to enact section 4503.4910 of the Revised Code to create the "KylerStrong Foundation" license plate.

items.name: S. B. No. 164
items.shorttitle: Prohibit abortion if unborn has or may have Down Syndrome
items.longtitle: To amend section 3701.79 and to enact sections 2919.10 and 2919.101 of the Revised Code to prohibit a person from performing, inducing, or attempting to perform or induce an abortion on a pregnant woman who is seeking the abortion because an unborn child has or may have Down Syndrome.

items.name: H. B. No. 133
items.shorttitle: Exempt out-of-state disaster relief persons from taxes and laws
items.longtitle: To amend sections 111.16, 718.01, 718.05, 1329.01, 4123.01, 4141.42, 5741.02, 5747.01, and 5751.01 and to enact sections 1701.041, 4799.04, and 5703.94 of the Revised Code to create the Disaster Relief Act to exempt out-of-state disaster businesses and qualifying out-of-state employees from certain taxes and laws with respect to disaster work on critical infrastructure performed in this state during a declared disaster.
items.version: As Reported by the House Public Utilities Committee

items.name: S. B. No. 8
items.shorttitle: Establish 1:1 School Facilities Option Program
items.longtitle: To enact section 3318.39 of the Revised Code to establish the 1:1 School Facilities Option Program as an alternative to assist certain school districts in constructing, acquiring, reconstructing, or making additions or repairs to any feature of a classroom facility.
items.version: As Reported by the House Education and Career Readiness Committee

items.name: S. B. No. 52
items.shorttitle: Permit anyone who registers to perform marriages
items.longtitle: To amend sections 3101.08, 3101.10, 3101.11, and 3101.12 of the Revised Code to allow any person or entity that registers with the secretary of state to solemnize marriages.

items.name: H. B. No. 286
items.shorttitle: Identify need and provide support for palliative care
items.longtitle: To enact sections 3701.36, 3701.361, and 3701.362 of the Revised Code to create the Palliative Care and Quality of Life Interdisciplinary Council, to establish the Palliative Care Consumer and Professional Information and Education Program, and to require health care facilities to identify patients and residents who could benefit from palliative care.

items.name: H. B. No. 288
items.shorttitle: Create Cuyahoga Heights Schools license plate
items.longtitle: To amend section 4501.21 and 4503.772 and to enact section 4503.878 of the Revised Code to create the "Cuyahoga Heights Schools" license plate.

items.name: H. B. No. 287
items.shorttitle: Create Post-Traumatic Stress license plate
items.longtitle: To enact section 4503.593 of the Revised Code to create the "Post-Traumatic Stress" license plate.

items.name: H. B. No. 124
items.shorttitle: Submit renewal tax levy to disenfranchised voters
items.longtitle: To enact section 5705.233 of the Revised Code to allow a county to propose as a single ballot question property taxes and a bond issue for the acquisition of, or permanent improvements to, criminal justice-related facilities and the operating expenses associated with such facilities and other criminal justice services, to authorize a joint vocational school district to submit the question of a renewal tax levy to voters who did not have an opportunity to vote on the levy at an election held in November of 2015 because the levy was only placed on the ballot in one of several counties in which the district has territory, and to declare an emergency.

items.name: H. B. No. 69
items.shorttitle: Reimburse medical service levy revenue forgone because of TIF
items.longtitle: To amend section 5709.40 of the Revised Code to require reimbursement of certain township fire and emergency medical service levy revenue forgone because of the creation of a municipal tax increment financing district.

items.name: S. B. No. 163
items.shorttitle: Modify qualifications for investing county inactive moneys
items.longtitle: To amend section 135.35 of the Revised Code to modify the qualifications regarding notes eligible for investment of county inactive moneys.

items.name: S. B. No. 2
items.shorttitle: Revise environmental protection laws

items.name: H. B. No. 195
items.shorttitle: Modify law regarding transport of people requiring mobility aid
items.longtitle: To amend sections 4766.01, 4766.04, and 4766.09 of the Revised Code to modify the provisions concerning the transport of persons who require the use of a wheelchair or other mobility aid in nonemergency circumstances.

items.name: H. B. No. 235
items.shorttitle: Regards procedures under Every Student Succeeds Act
items.longtitle: To amend section 3302.09 of the Revised Code regarding procedures for approval or disapproval of the state education plan for the federal Every Student Succeeds Act.
items.version: As Reported by the House Education and Career Readiness Committee

items.name: H. B. No. 125
items.shorttitle: Specify court jurisdiction over municipal traffic ordinances
items.longtitle: To amend sections 1901.20, 1907.02, and 4513.39 and to enact section 4511.072 of the Revised Code to specify the jurisdiction of municipal and county courts over municipal traffic ordinances, to clarify that certain township officers do not have the authority to enforce traffic and motor vehicle equipment violations on interstate highways, and to establish requirements governing fines, fees, or other charges for traffic violations and infractions imposed by a municipal corporation that does not have the authority to establish a mayor's court.
items.version: As Reported by the House Criminal Justice Committee

items.shorttitle: Enhanced IDs to facilitate crossing into Canada and Mexico

items.name: H. B. No. 170
items.shorttitle: Address computer science curriculum

items.shorttitle: Establish last mile residential broadband expansion program
items.longtitle: To enact sections 122.09, 122.091, 122.092, 122.093, 122.095, 122.096, 122.097, 122.098, 122.0910, 122.0911, 122.0912, 122.0913, 122.0915, and 122.0916 of the Revised Code to establish the residential broadband expansion program within the Development Services Agency to award matching grants for last mile broadband expansion in municipal corporations and townships and to make an appropriation.

items.name: H. B. No. 49
items.shorttitle: Creates FY 2018-2019 operating budget
items.version: As Pending in Senate Finance Committee
items.local_impact_statement: No - Not required for budget bills

items.name: H. B. No. 235
items.shorttitle: Regards procedures under Every Student Succeeds Act
items.longtitle: To amend section 3302.09 of the Revised Code regarding procedures for approval or disapproval of the state education plan for the federal Every Student Succeeds Act.

items.name: H. B. No. 277
items.shorttitle: Stay execution of judgment for Education Dept during appeal
items.longtitle: To amend section 2505.09 and to enact section 3301.132 of the Revised Code to stay the execution of certain judgments in favor of the Department of Education during the appeals process.

items.name: S. B. No. 157
items.shorttitle: Regulate reselling public utility service

items.name: H. B. No. 24
items.shorttitle: Modify veterans organization property tax exemption
items.longtitle: To amend section 5709.17 of the Revised Code to modify the existing tax exemption for veterans organizations' property to include property of certain veterans organizations exempt from federal taxation under section 501(c)(4) of the Internal Revenue Code and to exclude property that is not used primarily for meetings, administration, and the provision of programs and services to past and present members of the United States armed forces.
items.version: As Reported by the House Ways and Means Committee

items.name: H. B. No. 215
items.shorttitle: Create Paulding County Municipal Court
items.longtitle: To amend sections 1901.01, 1901.02, 1901.03, 1901.07, 1901.08, 1901.31, 1901.312, 1901.34, and 1907.11 of the Revised Code to create the Paulding County Municipal Court in Paulding on January 1, 2019, to establish one full-time judgeship in that court, to provide for the nomination of the judge by petition only, to abolish the Paulding County County Court on that date, to designate the Paulding County Clerk of Courts as the clerk of the Paulding County Municipal Court, and to provide for the election for the Paulding County Municipal Court of one full-time judge in 2018.

items.name: S. B. No. 37
items.shorttitle: Develop and conduct training for new police chiefs
items.longtitle: To amend sections 505.49, 737.052, and 737.15 and to enact section 109.804 of the Revised Code to require the Ohio Peace Officer Training Commission to develop and conduct a chief of police training course for newly appointed village, city, and township chiefs of police.

items.name: H. B. No. 283
items.shorttitle: Require juvenile judge to consent to adoption of abused children
items.longtitle: To enact section 3107.041 of the Revised Code to require the juvenile court judge to provide written consent to certain adoptions involving abused, neglected, or dependent children.

items.name: H. B. No. 282
items.shorttitle: Prohibit criminal mischief against residential rental property
items.longtitle: To amend section 2909.07 and to enact section 3735.411 of the Revised Code to expressly prohibit criminal mischief relating to residential rental property and to prohibit a metropolitan housing authority from renting or providing housing assistance to a person who has recently been convicted of criminal mischief relating to residential rental property.

items.name: S. B. No. 86
items.shorttitle: Designate Ohio National Missing Children's Day
items.longtitle: To enact section 5.291 of the Revised Code to designate the twenty-fifth day of May as "Ohio National Missing Children's Day."

items.name: H. B. No. 280
items.shorttitle: Permit wearing earplugs to protect hearing while motorcycling
items.longtitle: To amend section 4511.84 of the Revised Code to permit a person to wear earplugs for hearing protection while operating a motorcycle.

items.name: H. B. No. 279
items.shorttitle: Designate John Glenn's childhood home as historical site
items.longtitle: To require the Ohio History Connection to designate John Glenn's childhood home as a state historic site.

items.name: H. B. No. 278
items.shorttitle: Include harming police officer as vehicular assault
items.longtitle: To amend section 2903.08 of the Revised Code to  include negligently causing serious physical harm to a law enforcement officer while operating a motor vehicle or other specified mode of transportation as a violation of the offense of vehicular assault.

items.name: H. B. No. 188
items.shorttitle: Permit specialty kit car to have license plate on only rear
items.longtitle: To amend section 4503.21 of the Revised Code to authorize the owner or operator of a specialty kit car to display a license plate only on the rear of the car if the owner or operator pays a $150 fee.

items.name: S. B. No. 8
items.shorttitle: Establish 1:1 School Facilities Option Program
items.longtitle: To enact section 3318.39 of the Revised Code to establish the 1:1 School Facilities Option Program as an alternative to assist certain school districts in constructing, acquiring, reconstructing, or making additions or repairs to any feature of a classroom facility.

items.name: H. B. No. 154
items.shorttitle: Establish Commercial Truck Driver Student Aid Program
items.longtitle: To amend sections 3333.38 and 3345.32 and to enact section 3333.125 of the Revised Code to establish the Commercial Truck Driver Student Aid program and to make an appropriation.

items.name: H. B. No. 21
items.shorttitle: Verify community school enrollments
items.longtitle: To amend section 3314.11 of the Revised Code regarding verification of community school enrollments.

items.name: H. B. No. 125
items.shorttitle: Specify court jurisdiction over municipal traffic ordinances
items.longtitle: To amend sections 1901.20 and 1907.02 and to enact section 4511.072 of the Revised Code to specify the jurisdiction of municipal and county courts over municipal traffic ordinances and to establish requirements governing fines, fees, or other charges for traffic violations and infractions imposed by a municipal corporation that does not have the authority to establish a mayor's court.

items.name: H. B. No. 199
items.shorttitle: Enact Ohio Residential Mortgage Lending Act

items.name: H. B. No. 276
items.shorttitle: Prohibit menacing utility worker with intent to obstruct utility
items.longtitle: To amend section 2903.21 of the Revised Code to expand the offense of aggravated menacing to prohibit threatening a utility worker with intent to obstruct the operation of a utility.

items.name: H. B. No. 275
items.shorttitle: Designate Lance Cpl Michael Stangelo Memorial Bridge
items.longtitle: To enact section 5534.152 of the Revised Code to designate the bridge spanning the Tuscarawas River, that is part of State Route 93 in Canal Fulton, as the "Lance Corporal Michael Stangelo, USMC, Memorial Bridge."

items.name: H. B. No. 274
items.shorttitle: Modify reasons for which voter registration cancellable
items.longtitle: To amend sections 3501.05 and 3503.21 of the Revised Code to modify the circumstances under which a voter registration may be canceled.

items.name: H. B. No. 273
items.shorttitle: Prohibit requiring physician to have maintenance of certification
items.longtitle: To amend sections 3702.30, 3727.05, 4731.14, 4731.281, 4731.29, 4731.56, and 4731.57 and to enact sections 3727.061, 3901.89, and 5164.302 of the Revised Code to prohibit a physician from being required to secure a maintenance of certification as a condition of obtaining licensure, reimbursement, or employment or obtaining admitting privileges or surgical privileges at a hospital or health care facility.

items.name: H. B. No. 272
items.shorttitle: Grant hunting and fishing privileges with no or free license
items.longtitle: To amend sections 1533.10, 1533.11, 1533.111, 1533.112, 1533.12, 1533.32, and 1533.81 of the Revised Code to allow a landowner's grandchildren of any age to hunt or fish on the landowner's property without obtaining a hunting license, deer permit, wild turkey permit, fur taker permit, fishing license, or waterfowl hunting permit, and to allow certain partially disabled veterans to receive a free license, permit, or wetlands habitat stamp.

items.name: H. B. No. 271
items.shorttitle: Give notice before action for access; allow attorney's fees
items.longtitle: To enact section 4112.16 of the Revised Code to authorize an alleged aggrieved party to provide a notice of an alleged accessibility law violation in advance of filing a civil action and to establish the circumstances under which an alleged aggrieved party is entitled to attorney's fees in a civil action based on the violation.

items.name: H. B. No. 270
items.shorttitle: Designate Captain Michael Palumbo Memorial Highway
items.longtitle: To enact section 5534.491 of the Revised Code to designate a portion of I-271 in Cuyahoga County as the "Captain Michael Palumbo Memorial Highway."

items.name: H. B. No. 269
items.shorttitle: Rename workers' comp entities and revise benefits

items.name: H. B. No. 268
items.shorttitle: Change workers' comp self-insuring employer law
items.longtitle: To amend sections 4123.35, 4123.351, 4123.352, and 4123.82 and to enact section 4123.354 of the Revised Code to make changes to the Workers' Compensation Law with respect to self-insuring employers.

items.name: H. B. No. 267
items.shorttitle: Revise liabilities for negligent operation of subdivision vehicle
items.longtitle: To amend sections 2744.02 and 2744.05 of the Revised Code to eliminate certain defenses to political subdivision liability for an employee's negligent operation of a motor vehicle and to reduce damages recoverable against a political subdivision in such actions by the contributory fault of the plaintiff or other parties.

items.name: H. B. No. 266
items.shorttitle: Create Twinsburg City Schools license plate
items.longtitle: To amend section 4501.21 and to enact section 4503.907 of the Revised Code to create the "Twinsburg City Schools" license plate.

items.name: H. B. No. 265
items.shorttitle: Create Stow-Munroe Falls City Schools license plate
items.longtitle: To amend section 4501.21 and to enact section 4503.906 of the Revised Code to create the "Stow-Munroe Falls City Schools" license plate.

items.name: H. B. No. 264
items.shorttitle: Create Hudson City Schools license plate
items.longtitle: To amend section 4501.21 and to enact section 4503.905 of the Revised Code to create the "Hudson City Schools" license plate.

items.name: H. B. No. 263
items.shorttitle: Allow dogs in restaurant outdoor dining areas
items.longtitle: To enact section 3717.14 of the Revised Code to generally allow an owner, keeper, or harborer of a dog to take the dog in an outdoor dining area of a retail food establishment or food service operation.

items.name: H. B. No. 262
items.shorttitle: Prepare independent budget; authorize actuarial studies
items.longtitle: To amend section 126.02 and to enact sections 101.61, 103.31, 103.32, 103.33, 103.34, 103.35, 103.36, 103.37, and 103.38 of the Revised Code to provide for the preparation of a state biennial budget independent of that submitted by the Governor and to authorize the Legislative Service Commission, upon the request of the Speaker of the House of Representatives or the President of the Senate, to arrange for an independent actuarial review of a proposed bill, specified analyses of economic policy initiatives and state benchmarking data, and a study of the state's long-range financial outlook.

items.name: H. B. No. 261
items.shorttitle: Create Walsh Jesuit license plate
items.longtitle: To amend sections 4501.21 and 4503.772 and to enact section 4503.875 of the Revised Code to create the Walsh Jesuit license plate.

items.name: H. B. No. 260
items.shorttitle: Grant limited driving privileges in certain circumstances
items.longtitle: To enact section 4510.023 of the Revised Code to require a court to grant limited driving privileges to a person in relation to a driver's license suspension under certain circumstances.

items.name: H. B. No. 259
items.shorttitle: Create database of those who commit violent crimes in bars
items.longtitle: To enact section 4301.612 of the Revised Code to require the Attorney General to establish a database of persons who have committed an offense of violence at an A-1-A, A-1c, or D liquor permit premises and to provide access to the database to holders of those categories of liquor permits.

items.name: H. B. No. 257
items.shorttitle: Designate Army Specialist David Lee Bingamon Memorial Hwy
items.longtitle: To enact section 5534.804 of the Revised Code to designate a portion of U.S. Route 68 in Brown County as the "Army Specialist David Lee Bingamon Memorial Highway."

items.name: H. B. No. 256
items.shorttitle: Construct and operate major commercial service airports
items.longtitle: To enact sections 4563.40, 4563.41, 4565.01, 4565.02, 4565.03, 4565.04, 4565.05, 4565.06, 4565.07, 4565.08, 4565.09, 4565.10, 4565.11, 4565.111, 4565.12, 4565.13, 4565.14, 4565.15, 4565.16, 4565.17, 4565.18, and 4565.19 of the Revised Code to create the Major Air Hub Council, to require the Council to construct two commercial service airports, one in Fayette County and one in Portage County, and to create the Southern Ohio Airport Authority and the Northern Ohio Airport Authority to operate the airports.

items.name: S. B. No. 5
items.shorttitle: Address college affordability
items.longtitle: To amend section 5747.70 of the Revised Code to increase the maximum income tax deduction for contributions to college savings accounts and disability expense savings accounts to $4,000 annually for each beneficiary, to create the Joint Committee on Ohio College Affordability, and to declare an emergency.

items.name: H. B. No. 239
items.shorttitle: Allow recovery of national security generation resource cost
items.longtitle: To amend sections 4928.01, 4928.02, 4928.141, 4928.142, and 4928.143 of the Revised Code to allow electric distribution utilities to recover costs for a national security generation resource.

items.name: H. B. No. 200
items.shorttitle: Create Opportunity Scholarship Program

items.name: H. B. No. 8
items.shorttitle: Prohibit disclosing injuries to minors in school vehicles
items.longtitle: To amend section 149.43 and to enact section 149.436 of the Revised Code to exempt from the Public Records Law certain information concerning a minor that is included in a record related to a traffic accident involving a school vehicle in which the minor was an occupant at the time of the accident and to allow the parent or guardian of the minor to request a record of the accident containing the exempted information.

items.name: H. B. No. 68
items.shorttitle: Prohibit certain sexual conduct involving an impaired person
items.longtitle: To amend sections 2907.321, 2907.322, 2907.323, 2929.13, and 2929.14 of the Revised Code to include conduct involving an impaired person within the offenses of pandering obscenity involving a minor, pandering sexually oriented matter involving a minor, and illegal use of a minor in a nudity-oriented material or performance.

items.name: H. B. No. 63
items.shorttitle: Add prison term if disfigure or incapacitate victim
items.longtitle: To amend sections 2903.11, 2929.01, 2929.13, and 2929.14 and to enact section 2941.1425 of the Revised Code to require an additional prison term of 6 years for felonious assault if the offender also is convicted of a specification that charges that the offender used an accelerant in committing the offense and that the harm caused by the violation resulted in a permanent, serious disfigurement or permanent, substantial incapacity and to name the act's provisions "Judy's Law."

items.name: H. B. No. 46
items.shorttitle: Modify qualifications for investing county and library money
items.longtitle: To amend section 135.35 of the Revised Code to modify the qualifications regarding notes eligible for investment of county inactive moneys.

items.name: H. B. No. 132
items.shorttitle: Regulate fantasy contests
items.longtitle: To amend section 3772.03 and to enact sections 3774.01, 3774.02, 3774.03, 3774.04, 3774.05, 3774.06, 3774.07, 3774.08, and 3774.09 of the Revised Code to grant the Ohio Casino Control Commission the authority to regulate fantasy contests and to exempt fantasy contests from the gambling laws.

items.name: S. B. No. 162
items.shorttitle: Withhold local money if uncooperative with immigration policy
items.longtitle: To amend sections 9.63 and 5747.502 of the Revised Code to withhold local government fund payments to municipal corporations that have enacted an ordinance, policy, directive, rule, or resolution that hinders or prevents municipal employees from cooperating with state or federal immigration services or from complying with executive orders pertaining to immigration.

items.name: S. B. No. 160
items.shorttitle: Permit community service to pay for driver license reinstatement
items.longtitle: To amend section 4510.10 of the Revised Code to allow a court to authorize completion of a community service program in lieu of payment of driver's license reinstatement fees when the court determines that an offender cannot reasonably pay the fees.

items.name: S. B. No. 159
items.shorttitle: Permit sealing of criminal record if pardoned
items.longtitle: To amend sections 2953.51, 2953.52, and 2953.55 of the Revised Code to permit a person to apply for the sealing of the official records pertaining to a case in which the person was convicted of an offense for which the person is granted a pardon.

items.name: S. B. No. 158
items.shorttitle: Combat elder fraud and exploitation; require restitution for
items.longtitle: To amend sections 2913.02, 2913.21, 2913.31, 2913.43, 2913.49, and 5101.61 and to enact sections 109.67 and 173.95 of the Revised Code to develop best practices and educational opportunities to combat elder fraud and exploitation and to fine and require full restitution from offenders who are found guilty of certain fraud-related crimes against the elderly.

items.name: H. B. No. 27
items.shorttitle: Creates FY 2018-2019 Workers' Compensation budget
items.longtitle: To amend sections 742.38, 4113.21, 4121.125, 4121.44,  4123.29, 4123.343,  4123.512,  4123.53, 4123.54,  4123.56, 4123.57, 4123.66, 4123.68, 4123.71,  4123.84, 4125.05, 4125.051, 4125.07,  4167.01,  4167.02, and 4167.10  and to repeal sections  4123.72 and 4167.19 of the Revised Code to make  changes to the Workers' Compensation Law,  to  prohibit a public employer from requiring an  employee to pay for a medical examination as a  condition of continued employment,  to make  appropriations for the Bureau of Workers'  Compensation for the biennium beginning July 1,  2017, and ending June 30, 2019, and to provide  authorization and conditions for the operation of  the Bureau's programs.
items.version: As Reported by the Senate Insurance and Financial Institutions Committee
items.local_impact_statement: No - Not required for budget bills

items.name: H. B. No. 206
items.shorttitle: Create Commercial Airline and Air Freight Commission
items.longtitle: To enact section 4561.61 of the Revised Code to create the Commercial Airline and Air Freight Commission.

items.name: H. B. No. 231
items.shorttitle: Require dispensing of prescription drugs in lockable container
items.longtitle: To enact section 3719.051 of the Revised Code to require pharmacists to offer to dispense controlled substances in lockable or tamper-evident containers.

items.name: H. B. No. 233
items.shorttitle: Avoid crime if concealed carry into prohibited space and leave
items.longtitle: To amend sections 2917.11, 2923.11, 2923.12, 2923.121, 2923.122, 2923.123, 2923.126, and 2923.1212 of the Revised Code to enact the "Decriminalization Effort For Ending Notorious Deaths (DEFEND)" to provide an opportunity for a concealed handgun licensee or qualified military member to avoid guilt for carrying a concealed handgun into a prohibited place if the person leaves upon request, and to penalize as disorderly conduct failing to leave upon request or returning with a firearm.

items.name: H. B. No. 242
items.shorttitle: Permit SERS to grant reduced cost-of-living adjustments
items.longtitle: To amend sections 3309.374 and 3309.661 of the Revised Code regarding School Employees Retirement System annual cost-of-living adjustments.

items.name: H. B. No. 225
items.shorttitle: Regards plugging idle or orphaned wells
items.longtitle: To amend sections 1509.071, 1509.34, and 5747.01 of the Revised Code to allow a landowner to report an idle and orphaned well or abandoned well, to require the Chief of the Division of Oil and Gas Resources Management to inspect and classify such a well, to require the Chief to begin plugging a well classified as distressed-high priority within a specified time period, and to authorize an income tax deduction for reimbursements paid by the state to a landowner for costs incurred to plug an idle or orphaned well.

items.name: H. B. No. 229
items.shorttitle: Designate Charles Follis Day
items.longtitle: To enact section 5.261 of the Revised Code to designate February 3 as "Charles Follis Day."

items.name: H. B. No. 211
items.shorttitle: License home inspectors
items.longtitle: To amend sections 109.572, 121.08, 2925.01, 4745.01, 4776.10, and 4776.20 and to enact sections 4764.01 to 4764.20 and 4764.99 of the Revised Code to require the licensure of home inspectors and to create the Ohio Home Inspector Board to regulate the licensure and performance of home inspectors.

items.name: H. B. No. 79
items.shorttitle: Provide for firearms training for tactical medical professionals
items.longtitle: To amend sections 109.71, 109.73, 109.75, 109.79, 109.801, and 2923.126 and to enact sections 109.748 and 109.771 of the Revised Code to provide for firearms training for tactical medical professionals; to permit such a professional who has received that training and has been authorized by the law enforcement agency to carry firearms while on duty; and to grant such a professional the same right to carry a concealed handgun in this state as a concealed handgun licensee.

items.name: S. B. No. 115
items.shorttitle: Register roofing contractors
items.longtitle: To enact sections 4740.20, 4740.21, 4740.22, 4740.23, 4740.24, 4740.25, 4740.26, 4740.27, and 4740.28 of the Revised Code to require the registration of roofing contractors.

items.name: S. B. No. 145
items.shorttitle: Criminalize and create civil action for dismemberment abortion
items.longtitle: To amend sections 2305.114, 2307.53, 2901.01, 2903.09, 2919.123, 2919.151, and 2967.193 and to enact section 2919.15 of the Revised Code to criminalize and create a civil action for dismemberment abortions.

items.name: H. B. No. 251
items.shorttitle: Increase maturity of bonds eligible for investing interim money
items.longtitle: To amend section 135.14 of the Revised Code to increase from five to ten years the maturity period of other political subdivision's bonds and obligations eligible for investment of a subdivision's interim moneys.

items.name: H. B. No. 7
items.shorttitle: Address medical claims and provider immunities
items.longtitle: To amend sections 2305.113, 2305.252, 2305.51, 2317.421, 2317.43, and 2323.41 and to enact sections 2305.2311, 2317.44, 2317.45, 2323.40, and 2323.451 of the Revised Code to grant qualified civil immunity to certain medical providers who provide emergency medical services as a result of a disaster; to provide that certain communications made regarding an unanticipated outcome of medical care, the development or implementation of standards under federal laws, and an insurer's reimbursement policies on health care are inadmissible as evidence in a medical claim; to provide that medical bills itemizing charges are inadmissible as evidence and an amount accepted as full payment for medical services is admissible as evidence of the reasonableness of the charges; to specify the manner of sending a notice of intent to file a medical claim and provide a procedure for the discovery of other potential claims within a specified period after the filing of a medical claim; to provide that any loss of a chance of recovery or survival by itself is not an injury, death, or loss for which damages may be recovered; to provide civil immunity to certain medical providers regarding the discharge of a patient with a mental condition that threatens the safety of the patient or others; to require that governmental agencies that receive peer review committee records maintain their confidentiality; and to clarify the definition of "medical claim."

items.name: H. B. No. 222
items.shorttitle: Qualify concealed carry license as voting identification
items.longtitle: To amend section 3501.01 of the Revised Code to specify that a concealed handgun license qualifies as photo identification for voting purposes.

items.name: H. B. No. 247
items.shorttitle: Regards utility refunds, market rate service, corporate being
items.longtitle: To amend sections 4928.01, 4928.04, 4928.05, 4928.06, 4928.14, 4928.141, 4928.142, 4928.144, 4928.17, 4928.18, 4928.20, 4928.23, 4928.231, 4928.232, 4928.31, 4928.34, 4928.35, 4928.542, and 4933.81; to amend, for the purpose of adopting a new section number as indicated in parentheses, section 4928.04 (4928.041); to enact new section 4928.04 and sections 4903.191, 4928.28, 4928.281, 4928.29, and 4928.30; and to repeal section 4928.143 of the Revised Code to require refunds to utility customers who have been improperly charged, to eliminate electric security plans and require all electric standard service offers to be delivered through market-rate offers, and to strengthen corporate separation requirements.

items.name: H. B. No. 99
items.shorttitle: Modify workers' comp benefits for occupational pneumoconiosis

items.name: H. B. No. 245
items.shorttitle: List and disqualify employers who move call centers out of US
items.longtitle: To enact sections 4113.87, 4113.88, 4113.89, 4113.90, 4113.91, and 4113.92 of the Revised Code to enact the Consumer Protection Call Center Act of 2017 to require the Department of Job and Family Services to compile a list of all employers that relocate a call center to a foreign country and to disqualify employers on that list from state grants, loans, and other benefits.

items.name: H. B. No. 237
items.shorttitle: Give notice of local elections covering more than one county
items.longtitle: To amend sections 133.01, 133.06, 133.18, 513.13, 718.01, 718.04, 718.09, 718.10, 731.01, 733.261, 733.262, 3311.21, 3318.01, 3318.06, 3318.061, 3318.063, 3318.07, 3318.361, 3354.02, 3355.02, 3357.02, 3501.05, 3501.11, 3505.01, 3505.071, 3513.05, 5705.01, 5705.03, 5705.19, 5705.191, 5705.195, 5705.199, 5705.21, 5705.211, 5705.212, 5705.213, 5705.217, 5705.218, 5705.219, 5705.2111, 5705.2112, 5705.23, 5705.25, 5705.251, 5705.252, 5705.55, and 5705.72 and to enact section 3501.054 of the Revised Code to require a political subdivision with territory in more than one county that places an issue on the ballot to notify the board of elections of every county in which the political subdivision has territory, to require the Secretary of State to establish a database to facilitate communication between the boards of elections and the Secretary concerning local elections, and to make an appropriation.

items.name: H. B. No. 38
items.shorttitle: Increase penalty for murder or assault of certain persons
items.longtitle: To amend sections 2903.01, 2903.11, and 2923.02 of the Revised Code to provide that purposely causing the death of a first responder or military member is aggravated murder and to require an offender to serve a mandatory prison term for certain types of felonious assault or attempted aggravated murder when the victim is a first responder or military member.

items.name: S. B. No. 149
items.shorttitle: Regards using school district buildings as polling places
items.longtitle: To amend section 3501.29 and to enact section 3319.077 of the Revised Code regarding the use of a school district building as a polling place for elections.

items.name: H. B. No. 102
items.shorttitle: Revise school funding

items.name: S. B. No. 97
items.shorttitle: Study regional economic development alliances
items.longtitle: To establish a Regional Economic Development Alliance Study Committee to study the benefits and challenges involved in creating regional economic development alliances.

items.name: S. B. No. 152
items.shorttitle: Regards transfers of structured settlement payment rights
items.longtitle: To amend sections 2323.58, 2323.581, 2323.582, 2323.583, 2323.584, 2323.585, 2323.586, and 2323.587 of the Revised Code relative to transfers of structured settlement payment rights.

items.name: H. B. No. 255
items.shorttitle: Regards township traffic enforcement on interstates
items.longtitle: To amend sections 2935.03, 4511.093, and 4513.39 of the Revised Code to authorize a township officer who serves a population of greater than 5,000 to make arrests for specified traffic offenses on interstate highways within and adjacent to the officer's territory and to prohibit townships from using traffic law photo-monitoring devices on interstate highways.

items.name: H. B. No. 240
items.shorttitle: Require state higher ed to adopt sex offense policies
items.longtitle: To enact sections 5.236 and 3345.43 of the Revised Code to enact the "Respect Your Date Act" to designate the month of April as "Respect Your Date Month" and to require each state institution of higher education to adopt a policy regarding dating violence, domestic violence, sexual assault, stalking, and rape on campus and to declare an emergency.

items.name: S. B. No. 151
items.shorttitle: Permit SERS to grant reduced cost-of-living adjustments
items.longtitle: To amend section 3309.374 of the Revised Code to permit, rather than require, the School Employees Retirement System to grant annual cost-of-living adjustments to retirement, disability, and survivor benefit recipients and to reduce the maximum amount of the adjustment.

items.name: H. B. No. 168
items.shorttitle: Modify cemetery law
items.longtitle: To amend sections 1721.21, 1721.211, 4767.01, 4767.02, 4767.03, 4767.04, 4767.05, 4767.06, 4767.07, and 4767.08 and to enact sections 4767.021, 4767.09, and 4767.10 of the Revised Code to modify duties of the Division of Real Estate in the Department of Commerce regarding cemetery registration, to specify cemetery owners must reasonably maintain cemeteries, to establish the Cemetery Grant Program, and to make an appropriation.
items.version: As Reported by the House State and Local Government Committee

items.name: S. B. No. 20
items.shorttitle: Add prison term if permanently disable victim
items.longtitle: To amend sections 2903.11, 2919.22, 2929.01, 2929.13, and 2929.14 and to enact section 2941.1425 of the Revised Code to require an additional prison term of 3 to 8 years for an offender who is convicted in specified circumstances of a felony offense of endangering children or felonious assault of a child if the offender also is convicted of a specification that the victim suffered permanent disabling harm and to name the act "Destiny's Law."

items.name: H. B. No. 204
items.shorttitle: Create Department of Grants and Philanthropic Gestures
items.longtitle: To amend sections 121.02 and 121.03 and to enact section 121.77 of the Revised Code to create the Department of Grants and Philanthropic Gestures.

items.name: H. B. No. 258
items.shorttitle: Prohibit abortion if unborn has detectable heartbeat
items.longtitle: To amend sections 2317.56, 2919.171, 2919.19, 2919.191, 2919.192, 2919.193, and 4731.22; to amend, for the purpose of adopting new section numbers as indicated in parentheses, sections 2919.191 (2919.192), 2919.192 (2919.194), and 2919.193 (2919.198); and to enact new sections 2919.191 and 2919.193 and sections 2919.195, 2919.196, 2919.197, 2919.199, 2919.1910, and 2919.1911 of the Revised Code to generally prohibit an abortion of an unborn human individual with a detectable heartbeat and to create the Joint Legislative Committee on Adoption Promotion and Support.

items.name: H. B. No. 241
items.shorttitle: Establish Ohio Diabetes Registry
items.longtitle: To amend section 3701.99 and to enact sections 3701.36 to 3701.366 of the Revised Code to establish the Ohio Diabetes Registry.

items.name: H. B. No. 10
items.shorttitle: Permit intrastate equity crowdfunding
items.longtitle: To amend sections 1707.03, 1724.02, 4582.06, and 4582.31 and to enact sections 1707.05, 1707.051, 1707.052, 1707.053, 1707.054, 1707.055, 1707.056, 1707.057, and 1707.058 of the Revised Code to permit intrastate equity crowdfunding under certain circumstances.

items.name: H. B. No. 243
items.shorttitle: Exempt firewood and other heating fuels from sales tax
items.longtitle: To amend sections 131.51 and 5739.02 and to enact sections 5739.212 and 5741.033 of the Revised Code to exempt from sales and use taxation the bulk sale of firewood and certain other heating fuels, and to reimburse the Local Government Fund and Public Library Fund and county and transit sales tax collections for the resulting revenue losses.

items.name: H. B. No. 28
items.shorttitle: Creates FY 2018-2019 Industrial Commission budget
items.longtitle:
To make appropriations for the Industrial Commission for the biennium beginning July 1, 2017, and ending June 30, 2019, and to provide authorization and conditions for the operation of Commission
programs.
items.local_impact_statement: No - Not required for budget bills

items.name: H. B. No. 254
items.shorttitle: Require POW/MIA Flag to be displayed on certain days
items.longtitle: To amend section 9.50 of the Revised Code to enact the POW/MIA Remembrance Act requiring the POW/MIA flag to be displayed at certain buildings operated by the state on Armed Forces Day, Memorial Day, Flag Day, Independence Day, National POW/MIA Recognition Day, and Veterans' Day.

items.name: H. B. No. 252
items.shorttitle: Designate Blood Donor Awareness Month
items.longtitle: To enact section 5.2519 of the Revised Code to designate the month of January as "Blood Donor Awareness Month."

items.name: H. B. No. 48
items.shorttitle: Protect public and cemetery war relics
items.longtitle: To amend section 149.30 and to enact section 155.28 of the Revised Code to prohibit a war relic that is located on public property or on the property of a cemetery association from being sold or otherwise disposed of, or destroyed, relocated, removed, altered, or otherwise disturbed, except under certain circumstances.

items.name: H. B. No. 238
items.shorttitle: Establish Veterans Fee Waiver Program
items.longtitle: To amend sections 111.16, 111.17, 1703.31, 1729.12, 1746.06, 1782.63, 2305.10, and 4743.04 and to enact sections 5903.21, 5903.22, 5903.23, 5903.24, and 5903.25 of the Revised Code to establish the Veterans Fee Waiver Program.

items.name: H. B. No. 197
items.shorttitle: Reimburse insurance for EMT services in nonemergencies
items.longtitle: To enact sections 4765.362, 4765.363, and 5164.11 of the Revised Code to provide for insurance reimbursement for EMT services in nonemergency situations.

items.name: H. B. No. 28
items.shorttitle: Creates FY 2018-2019 Industrial Commission budget
items.longtitle:
To make appropriations for the Industrial Commission for the biennium beginning July 1, 2017, and ending June 30, 2019, and to provide authorization and conditions for the operation of Commission
programs.
items.local_impact_statement: No - Not required for budget bills

items.name: S. B. No. 86
items.shorttitle: Designate Ohio National Missing Children's Day
items.longtitle: To enact section 5.291 of the Revised Code to designate the twenty-fifth day of May as "Ohio National Missing Children's Day."
items.version: As Reported by the Senate Local Government, Public Safety and Veterans Affairs Committee

items.name: S. B. No. 5
items.shorttitle: Address college affordability
items.longtitle: To amend section 5747.70 of the Revised Code to increase the maximum income tax deduction for contributions to college savings accounts and disability expense savings accounts to $4,000 annually for each beneficiary, to create the Joint Committee on Ohio College Affordability, and to declare an emergency.
items.version: As Reported by Senate Finance Committee

items.name: H. B. No. 28
items.shorttitle: Creates FY 2018-2019 Industrial Commission budget
items.longtitle:
To make appropriations for the Industrial Commission for the biennium beginning July 1, 2017, and ending June 30, 2019, and to provide authorization and conditions for the operation of Commission
programs.
items.version: As Reported by the Senate Transportation, Commerce and Workforce Committee
items.local_impact_statement: No - Not required for budget bills

items.name: S. B. No. 5
items.shorttitle: Address college affordability
items.longtitle: To amend section 5747.70 of the Revised Code to increase the maximum income tax deduction for contributions to college savings accounts and disability expense savings accounts to $10,000 annually for each beneficiary, to create the Joint Committee on Ohio College Affordability, and to declare an emergency.

items.name: H. B. No. 230
items.shorttitle: Prohibit restricting display of thin blue line flag
items.longtitle: To amend sections 4781.40, 5301.072, 5311.191, and 5321.131 of the Revised Code to prohibit manufactured home park operators, condominium associations, neighborhood associations, and landlords from restricting the display of the thin blue line flag.

items.name: S. B. No. 25
items.shorttitle: Create new municipal court
items.longtitle: To amend sections 1901.01, 1901.02, 1901.03, 1901.07, 1901.08, 1901.31, 1901.312, 1901.34, and 1907.11 of the Revised Code and to amend Section 729.10 of Am. Sub. H.B. 483 of the 130th General Assembly, as subsequently amended, to create the Perry County Municipal Court in New Lexington on January 1, 2018, to establish one full-time judgeship in that court, to provide for the nomination of the judge by petition only, to abolish the Perry County County Court on that date, to designate the Perry County Clerk of Courts as the clerk of the Perry County Municipal Court, to provide for the election for the Perry County Municipal Court of one full-time judge in 2017, to modify the provisions regarding the membership of the Criminal Justice Recodification Committee, and to declare an emergency.

items.name: H. B. No. 181
items.shorttitle: Address academic content standards and assessments

items.name: S. B. No. 120
items.shorttitle: Address debt adjusting
items.longtitle: To amend section 4710.01 and to enact section 4710.05 of the Revised Code regarding debt adjusting.

items.name: S. B. No. 116
items.shorttitle: Receive unemployment comp if quit to accompany military spouse
items.longtitle: To amend section 4141.29 of the Revised Code to permit persons who quit work to accompany the person's spouse on a military transfer to be eligible for unemployment compensation benefits.

items.name: H. B. No. 227
items.shorttitle: Create Kenston Local Schools license plate
items.longtitle: To amend section 4501.21 and to enact section 4503.88 of the Revised Code to create the "Kenston Local Schools" license plate.
items.version: As Reported by the House Transportation and Public Safety Committee

items.name: H. B. No. 50
items.shorttitle: Establish specifications for electronic benefit transfer cards
items.longtitle: To amend sections 4501.27, 5101.33, and 5101.542 and to enact section 5101.331 of the Revised Code to establish requirements for electronic benefit transfer cards issued under the Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program.
items.version: As Reported by the House Community and Family Advancement Committee

items.name: S. B. No. 25
items.shorttitle: Create new municipal court
items.longtitle: To amend sections 1901.01, 1901.02, 1901.03, 1901.07, 1901.08, 1901.31, 1901.312, 1901.34, and 1907.11 of the Revised Code and to amend Section 729.10 of Am. Sub. H.B. 483 of the 130th General Assembly, as subsequently amended, to create the Perry County Municipal Court in New Lexington on January 1, 2018, to establish one full-time judgeship in that court, to provide for the nomination of the judge by petition only, to abolish the Perry County County Court on that date, to designate the Perry County Clerk of Courts as the clerk of the Perry County Municipal Court, to provide for the election for the Perry County Municipal Court of one full-time judge in 2017, to modify the provisions regarding the membership of the Criminal Justice Recodification Committee, and to declare an emergency.

items.name: H. B. No. 183
items.shorttitle: Establish Aviation Hall of Fame and Learning Center Board
items.longtitle: To enact section 4561.02 of the Revised Code to establish the Governing Board of the Ohio Aviation Hall of Fame and Learning Center for purposes of establishing the Hall and inducting persons into it.
items.version: As Reported by the House Armed Services, Veterans Affairs, and Homeland Security Committee

items.name: H. B. No. 205
items.shorttitle: Limit consequences of property tax delinquencies for seniors
items.longtitle: To amend sections 323.25, 5721.18, and 5721.31 of the Revised Code to enact the "Senior Housing Relief Act" to prohibit the sale of delinquent property tax certificates for homesteads owned for at least 20 years by a person aged 65 or older at the time of the sale and to prohibit tax foreclosure on such property when the senior homeowner has paid the current taxes in all but five or fewer taxable years.

items.name: H. B. No. 135
items.shorttitle: Designate Superman Day
items.longtitle: To enact section 5.49 of the Revised Code to designate June 12th as "Superman Day."
items.version: As Reported by the House State and Local Government Committee

items.name: H. B. No. 27
items.shorttitle: Creates FY 2018-2019 Workers' Compensation budget
items.longtitle: To amend sections 742.38, 2743.02, 2744.02, 4113.21,  4121.125, 4121.44, 4123.01, 4123.29, 4123.343,  4123.511,  4123.512,  4123.53, 4123.54, 4123.56,  4123.57, 4123.66, 4123.68, 4123.71, 4123.84,  4125.07,  4167.01, 4167.02, and 4167.10, to enact  sections 1.481,  2307.82, and 4123.513,  and to  repeal sections 4123.72 and 4167.19 of the Revised  Code to make changes to the Workers' Compensation  Law,  to prohibit a public employer from requiring  an employee to pay for a medical examination as a  condition of continued employment, to prohibit  state agencies from taking actions that have  retrospective effects,  to make appropriations for  the Bureau of Workers' Compensation for the  biennium beginning July 1, 2017, and ending June  30, 2019, and to provide authorization and  conditions for the operation of the Bureau's  programs.
items.local_impact_statement: No - Not required for budget bills

items.name: H. B. No. 32
items.shorttitle: Apply criminal penalties to casinos and affiliated casinos
items.longtitle: To amend section 3772.99 of the Revised Code to specify that the criminal penalty related to casino operators and employees participating in casino gaming applies at their casino facility or an affiliated casino facility.

items.name: H. B. No. 219
items.shorttitle: Specify speed limit effective reasonable distance from sign
items.longtitle: To amend section 4511.21 of the Revised Code to specify that a speed limit becomes effective at a reasonable distance from the appropriate sign giving notice of the speed limit.

items.name: H. B. No. 227
items.shorttitle: Create Kenston Local Schools license plate
items.longtitle: To amend section 4501.21 and to enact section 4503.88 of the Revised Code to create the "Kenston Local Schools" license plate.

items.name: S. B. No. 25
items.shorttitle: Create new municipal court
items.longtitle: To amend sections 1901.01, 1901.02, 1901.03, 1901.07, 1901.08, 1901.31, 1901.312, 1901.34, and 1907.11 of the Revised Code and to amend Section 729.10 of Am. Sub. H.B. 483 of the 130th General Assembly, as subsequently amended, to create the Perry County Municipal Court in New Lexington on January 1, 2018, to establish one full-time judgeship in that court, to provide for the nomination of the judge by petition only, to abolish the Perry County County Court on that date, to designate the Perry County Clerk of Courts as the clerk of the Perry County Municipal Court, to provide for the election for the Perry County Municipal Court of one full-time judge in 2017, to modify the provisions regarding the membership of the Criminal Justice Recodification Committee, and to declare an emergency.
items.version: As Reported by the House Criminal Justice Committee

items.name: H. B. No. 46
items.shorttitle: Modify qualifications for investing county and library money
items.longtitle: To amend section 135.35 of the Revised Code to modify the qualifications regarding notes eligible for investment of county inactive moneys.
items.version: As Reported by the House Financial Institutions, Housing, and Urban Development Committee

items.name: H. B. No. 68
items.shorttitle: Prohibit certain sexual conduct involving an impaired person
items.longtitle: To amend sections 2907.321, 2907.322, 2907.323, 2929.13, and 2929.14 of the Revised Code to include conduct involving an impaired person within the offenses of pandering obscenity involving a minor, pandering sexually oriented matter involving a minor, and illegal use of a minor in a nudity-oriented material or performance.
items.version: As Reported by the House Criminal Justice Committee

items.name: H. B. No. 170
items.shorttitle: Address computer science curriculum
items.longtitle: To amend sections 3301.079, 3313.603, and 3319.074 and to enact sections 3301.012 and 3319.236 of the Revised Code with regard to academic content standards and curriculum requirements for computer science; to revise educator qualifications regarding computer science; to create a competitive technology grant program for the 2018-2019 school year; and to make an appropriation.

items.name: S. B. No. 24
items.shorttitle: Enact Consumer Installment Loan Act

items.name: H. B. No. 223
items.shorttitle: Regards transfers of structured settlement payment rights
items.longtitle: To amend sections 2323.58, 2323.581, 2323.582, 2323.583, 2323.584, 2323.585, 2323.586, and 2323.587 of the Revised Code relative to transfers of structured settlement payment rights.

items.name: S. B. No. 9
items.shorttitle: Provide sales tax holiday
items.longtitle: To provide for a three-day sales tax "holiday" in August 2017 during which sales of clothing and school supplies are exempt from sales and use taxes and to declare an emergency.

items.name: S. B. No. 24
items.shorttitle: Enact Consumer Installment Loan Act

items.name: H. B. No. 160
items.shorttitle: Expand civil rights and related procedures
items.longtitle: To amend sections 9.03, 124.93, 125.111, 153.59, 153.591, 340.12, 511.03, 717.01, 1501.012, 1751.18, 2927.03, 3113.36, 3301.53, 3304.15, 3304.50, 3314.06, 3332.09, 3721.13, 3905.55, 4111.17, 4112.01, 4112.02, 4112.021, 4112.04, 4112.05, 4112.08, 4117.19, 4735.16, 4735.55, 4757.07, 4758.16, 4765.18, 5104.09, 5107.26, 5123.351, 5126.07, 5165.08, 5515.08, and 5709.832 of the Revised Code to enact the Ohio Fairness Act to prohibit discrimination on the basis of sexual orientation or gender identity or expression, to add mediation to the list of informal methods by which the Ohio Civil Rights Commission may use to induce compliance with Ohio's Civil Rights Law before instituting a formal hearing, and to uphold existing religious exemptions under Ohio's Civil Rights Law.

items.name: H. B. No. 150
items.shorttitle: Create special license plate for hearing-impaired individuals
items.longtitle: To enact section 4503.441 of the Revised Code to create a special license plate for hearing-impaired individuals.

items.name: S. B. No. 150
items.shorttitle: Prohibit person liable to domestic violence from having firearm
items.longtitle: To amend sections 2903.13, 2919.25, 2919.26, 2923.13, 2923.14, and 3113.31 and to enact sections 2923.133 and 2923.134 of the Revised Code to prohibit a person convicted of domestic violence or assault of a family member, or a person subject to certain protection orders, from having a firearm; to establish a procedure for surrendering all firearms in the person's possession; and to name the act the "Domestic Violence Survivors Protection Act."

items.name: H. B. No. 190
items.shorttitle: Stop, watch, and listen for on-track equipment at rail crossings
items.longtitle: To amend sections 4511.62, 4511.63, 4511.64, and 4511.712 of the Revised Code to require vehicle operators to watch, listen, and stop for on-track equipment that may be approaching a railroad crossing.

items.name: H. B. No. 184
items.shorttitle: Change dental practice and dental hygiene laws
items.longtitle: To amend sections 1739.05, 2925.01, 4715.03, 4715.09, 4715.10, 4715.11, 4715.13, 4715.14, 4715.22, 4715.36, 4715.39, and 4715.64 and to enact sections 1751.90, 3333.614, 3923.90, 4715.43, 4715.431, 4715.432, 4715.433, 4715.434, 4715.435, 4715.436, 4715.437, and 5164.951 of the Revised Code to authorize the provision of dental services through teledentistry, to require a proposal for creation of a primary care dental student component of the Choose Ohio First Scholarship Program, and to make other changes to the laws governing the practices of dentistry and dental hygiene.

items.name: S. B. No. 113
items.shorttitle: Levy additional vehicle registration tax and adjust fuel taxes
items.longtitle: To amend sections 4503.10, 5735.06, and 5735.10 and to enact sections 4501.50, 4503.106, and 5735.50 of the Revised Code to levy an additional registration tax on passenger cars, noncommercial motor vehicles, and commercial cars and trucks beginning on January 1, 2020; to authorize a per-gallon motor fuel retail price reduction for consumers that is equal to the state per-gallon motor fuel tax of $.28; and to exempt each gallon of motor fuel that is sold at the reduced retail price from the state motor fuel tax.

items.name: H. B. No. 133
items.shorttitle: Exempt out-of-state disaster relief persons from taxes and laws
items.longtitle: To amend sections 111.16, 718.01, 718.05, 1329.01, 4123.01, 4141.42, 5741.02, 5747.01, and 5751.01 and to enact sections 1701.041, 4799.04, and 5703.94 of the Revised Code to create the Disaster Relief Act to exempt out-of-state disaster businesses and qualifying out-of-state employees from certain taxes and laws with respect to disaster work on critical infrastructure performed in this state during a declared disaster.

items.name: H. B. No. 218
items.shorttitle: Expand probate court duties regarding park districts
items.longtitle: To amend section 1545.06 of the Revised Code to expand a probate court's powers and duties with regard to a park district.

items.name: H. B. No. 26
items.shorttitle: Creates FY 2018-2019 transportation budget
items.local_impact_statement: No - Not required for budget bills
items.effective_date_notes: Certain provisions effective on other dates; contains item vetoes

items.name: S. B. No. 144
items.shorttitle: Establish Opportunities for Ohioans with Disabilities Council
items.longtitle: To amend sections 3304.22, 4141.04, and 4765.04, to enact new sections 3304.12, 3304.13, and 3304.14, and to repeal sections 3303.41, 3304.12, 3304.13, 3304.14, and 3304.25 of the Revised Code to abolish the Opportunities for Ohioans with Disabilities Commission, Consumer Advisory Committee, and Governor's Council on People with Disabilities and to establish a state rehabilitation services council known as the Opportunities for Ohioans with Disabilities Council.

items.name: H. B. No. 216
items.shorttitle: Grant sales tax trade-in credit for buying used motor vehicle
items.longtitle: To amend section 5739.01 of the Revised Code to authorize a sales and use tax trade-in credit for purchases of used motor vehicles from a licensed dealer.

items.name: H. B. No. 9
items.shorttitle: Limit scope of protocol for malfunctioning traffic signals
items.longtitle: To amend section 4511.132 of the Revised Code to specify that the alternative protocol for proceeding into an intersection with malfunctioning traffic lights due to a failure of a vehicle detector applies only to bicycles, and to declare an emergency.

items.name: H. B. No. 84
items.shorttitle: Designate June as Ohio Goes Boating Month
items.longtitle: To enact section 5.47 of the Revised Code to designate June as "Ohio Goes Boating Month."

items.name: S. B. No. 132
items.shorttitle: Establish pilot tax credit if redeploy for jobs or energy in FTZ
items.longtitle: To amend section 5751.98 and to enact section 5751.15 of the Revised Code to establish a five-year pilot program whereby taxpayers with facilities in this state with activated foreign trade zone status may claim a nonrefundable commercial activity tax credit equal to the amount redeployed by the taxpayer to job creation and renewable energy resources.

items.name: H. B. No. 168
items.shorttitle: Modify cemetery law
items.longtitle: To amend sections 1721.21, 1721.211, 4767.01, 4767.02, 4767.03, 4767.04, 4767.05, 4767.06, 4767.07, and 4767.08 and to enact sections 4767.021, 4767.09, and 4767.10 of the Revised Code to modify duties of the Division of Real Estate in the Department of Commerce regarding cemetery registration, to specify cemetery owners must reasonably maintain cemeteries, to establish the Cemetery Grant Program, and to make an appropriation.

items.name: H. B. No. 187
items.shorttitle: Regulate use of information obtained from job applicants
items.longtitle: To enact sections 4177.01, 4177.02, 4177.03, 4177.04, and 4177.05 of the Revised Code to regulate the collection, use, and retention of certain information obtained from an applicant during the employee selection process.

items.name: S. B. No. 4
items.shorttitle: Expand expungement and intervention
items.longtitle: To amend sections 2951.041 and 2953.38 and to enact section 2953.521 of the Revised Code to allow a person who is found not guilty of an offense or who is the defendant named in a dismissed criminal charge to apply for a court order to expunge the person's official records in the case if the charge or not guilty finding was the result of the applicant having been a human trafficking victim; to allow a person convicted of certain prostitution-related offenses to apply for the expungement of the conviction record of any offense, other than a specified disqualifying offense, the person's participation in which was a result of having been a human trafficking victim; and to allow intervention in lieu of conviction for persons charged with committing an offense while a victim of compelling prostitution.

items.name: S. B. No. 139
items.shorttitle: Adopt Uniform Electronic Legal Material Act
items.longtitle: To enact sections 149.21, 149.22, 149.23, 149.24, 149.25, 149.26, and 149.27 of the Revised Code to adopt the Uniform Electronic Legal Material Act.

items.name: H. B. No. 249
items.shorttitle: Adopt rules governing residential utility reselling
items.longtitle: To enact sections 4941.01, 4941.03, 4941.05, 4941.07, 4941.08, 4941.09, 4941.11, and 4941.13 of the Revised Code to permit the Public Utilities Commission to adopt rules governing residential utility reselling.

items.name: S. B. No. 32
items.shorttitle: Narrow scope of speedy trial rules
items.longtitle: To amend sections 2945.71 and 2945.73 of the Revised Code to provide a prosecutor an additional fourteen days to commence a trial after a person charged with a felony has been discharged because the person has not been brought to trial within the required amount of time and to authorize the court to release the person from detention in connection with those charges pending trial.

items.name: H. B. No. 232
items.shorttitle: Grant temporary tax deduction for pro bono legal work
items.longtitle: To amend section 5747.01 and to enact section 5747.014 of the Revised Code to authorize, for six years, a personal income tax deduction for attorneys and pass-through entity law firms based on the number of hours the attorney performed pro bono legal work for indigent clients through a legal aid society and the expenses associated with that work.

items.name: H. B. No. 228
items.shorttitle: Regards self-defense and handling firearms
items.longtitle: To amend sections 307.932, 2307.601, 2901.05, 2901.09, 2923.12, 2923.126, 2923.16, and 2953.37 and to repeal section 2923.1212 of the Revised Code to assign to the prosecution the burden of disproving a self-defense or related claim, to expand the locations at which a person has no duty to retreat before using force under both civil and criminal law, and to modify the Concealed Handgun Licensing Law regarding a licensee's duty to keep the licensee's hands in plain sight, the penalties for illegally carrying a concealed firearm or improperly handling firearms in a motor vehicle, and the posting of warning signs regarding the possession of weapons on specified premises.

items.name: H. B. No. 192
items.shorttitle: Permit adding members to county veterans service commissions
items.longtitle: To amend section 5901.02 and to enact section 5901.022 of the Revised Code to permit county veterans service commissions to elect to add two members to the commission, one who is a veteran who served in Operation Enduring Freedom or Operation Iraqi Freedom, or subsequently in those theaters of operation, and one who is a military spouse.

items.name: H. B. No. 37
items.shorttitle: Improve school safety and technology infrastructure
items.longtitle: To enact section 3318.39 of the Revised Code to require the Ohio School Facilities Commission to establish a program assisting school districts in purchasing technology and making physical alterations to improve technology infrastructure and school safety and security.

items.name: H. B. No. 166
items.shorttitle: Revise workforce development laws

items.name: S. B. No. 146
items.shorttitle: Army Spec 4 Lawrence George Stapleton Memorial Hwy
items.longtitle: To enact section 5534.601 of the Revised Code to designate a portion of I-90 in Euclid as the "Army Specialist 4 Lawrence George Stapleton Memorial Highway."

items.name: H. B. No. 193
items.shorttitle: Prohibit penalizing employee for not getting flu vaccination
items.longtitle: To enact section 4113.73 of the Revised Code to prohibit an employer from taking an adverse employment action against a person who has not been or will not be vaccinated against influenza.

items.name: H. B. No. 71
items.shorttitle: Make failure to display front license plate a secondary offense
items.longtitle: To amend sections 4503.21 and 4511.043 of the Revised Code to specify that failure to display a license plate on the front of a motor vehicle that is required to display a front license plate is a secondary traffic offense and to establish a maximum fine of $100 for such an offense.

items.name: H. B. No. 77
items.shorttitle: License sick-child care centers
items.longtitle: To amend sections 5104.01, 5104.015, and 5104.99 and to enact sections 5104.0113, 5104.15, 5104.16, and 5104.17 of the Revised Code to provide for the licensure of sick-child care centers.

items.name: H. B. No. 185
items.shorttitle: Expand political contribution income tax credit
items.longtitle: To amend section 5747.29 of the Revised Code to expand the scope of political contributions that qualify for the income tax credit for contributions to political campaigns to candidates for any state, county, municipal, or district office.

items.name: S. B. No. 131
items.shorttitle: Count home-based employees for job creation tax credit
items.longtitle: To amend section 122.17 of the Revised Code to provide that compensation paid to certain home-based employees may be counted for purposes of an employer qualifying for and complying with the terms of a Job Creation Tax Credit.

items.name: H. B. No. 145
items.shorttitle: Establish confidential program to treat impaired practitioners
items.longtitle: To amend sections 4730.32, 4731.224, 4731.25, 4760.16, 4762.16, and 4774.16 and to enact sections 4731.251, 4731.252, 4731.253, and 4778.17 of the Revised Code to provide for the establishment of a confidential program for the treatment of certain impaired practitioners and to declare an emergency.

items.name: H. B. No. 115
items.shorttitle: Create register of persons having a communication disability
items.longtitle: To enact sections 3304.23 and 5502.08 of the Revised Code to require the Department of Public Safety to establish a database of persons who are diagnosed with a communication disability and to require the Opportunities for Ohioans with Disabilities Agency to establish a verification form for persons to voluntarily register for inclusion in the database.

items.name: S. B. No. 148
items.shorttitle: Prohibit soliciting business from accident report/emergency data
items.longtitle: To amend sections 4501.81 and 5502.11 of the Revised Code to require an accident report to indicate whether any person involved in the accident wishes to be contacted for commercial solicitation purposes, to prohibit any person from using the information contained in an accident report for those purposes with regard to a person who did not agree to be contacted, and to allow a person to submit emergency contact information upon vehicle registration for inclusion in the next of kin database.

items.name: H. B. No. 194
items.shorttitle: Establish special license plates for military service and awards
items.longtitle: To enact section 4503.29 and to repeal sections 4503.431, 4503.432, 4503.433, 4503.434, 4503.48, 4503.481, 4503.53, 4503.532, 4503.533, 4503.536, 4503.537, 4503.538, 4503.54, 4503.541, 4503.543, 4503.544, 4503.547, 4503.548, 4503.571, 4503.581, 4503.59, and 4503.731 of the Revised Code to establish a program for the issuance of special license plates related to military service and awards.
items.version: As Reported by the House Transportation and Public Safety Committee

items.name: S. B. No. 77
items.shorttitle: Create KylerStrong Foundation license plate
items.longtitle: To amend section 4501.21 and to enact section 4503.4991 of the Revised Code to create the "KylerStrong Foundation" license plate.

items.name: H. B. No. 202
items.shorttitle: Designate Veterans Suicide Awareness Day
items.longtitle: To enact section 5.481 of the Revised Code to designate the first Saturday of May as "Veterans Suicide Awareness Day."
items.version: As Reported by the House Armed Services, Veterans Affairs, and Homeland Security Committee

items.name: H. B. No. 246
items.shorttitle: Provide funding for county DD board classroom facilities
items.longtitle: To enact section 3318.80 of the Revised Code to require the Ohio School Facilities Commission to provide funding to certain county boards of developmental disabilities to assist in the acquisition of classroom facilities.

items.name: H. B. No. 127
items.shorttitle: Establish structural steel and bridge welding requirements
items.longtitle: To enact section 3781.21 of the Revised Code to establish in the Ohio Building Code requirements pertaining to structural steel welding and bridge welding.

items.name: H. B. No. 253
items.shorttitle: Permit law enforcement to conceal carry where prohibited
items.longtitle: To amend sections 2923.12, 2923.121, 2923.123, and 2923.126 of the Revised Code to permit law enforcement officers to carry firearms off duty in places otherwise prohibited for concealed handgun licensees.

items.name: S. B. No. 155
items.shorttitle: Allow recovery of national security generation resource costs
items.longtitle: To amend sections 4928.01, 4928.02, 4928.141, 4928.142, and 4928.143 of the Revised Code to allow electric distribution utilities to recover costs for a national security generation resource.

items.name: S. B. No. 117
items.shorttitle: Designate Drive Ohio Byways Month
items.longtitle: To enact section 5.292 of the Revised Code to designate May as "Drive Ohio Byways Month."

items.name: H. B. No. 5
items.shorttitle: Define "microbusiness."
items.longtitle: To enact section 166.50 of the Revised Code to create a statutory definition of "microbusiness."

items.name: S. B. No. 154
items.shorttitle: Provide for prevention and treatment of opioid addiction
items.longtitle: To amend sections 109.90, 1739.05, 1751.01, 3715.89, 4729.54, 4729.69, 4729.99, 5119.49, and 5167.12 and to enact sections 1751.692, 1751.76, 3301.97, 3707.60, 3901.80, 3901.801, 3923.046, 3923.852, 5119.368, 5164.092, and 5164.7512 of the Revised Code to provide for the prevention and treatment of opioid addiction, to make an appropriation, and to declare an emergency.

items.name: H. B. No. 236
items.shorttitle: Enact Model Elevator Act

items.name: S. B. No. 9
items.shorttitle: Provide sales tax holiday
items.longtitle: To provide for a three-day sales tax "holiday" in August 2017 during which sales of clothing and school supplies are exempt from sales and use taxes and to declare an emergency.

items.name: H. B. No. 174
items.shorttitle: Add judges to Franklin County Domestic Relations Division
items.longtitle: To amend sections 2301.02 and 2301.03 of the Revised Code to add two judges to the Domestic Relations Division of the Franklin County Court of Common Pleas to be elected in 2018.

items.name: H. B. No. 210
items.shorttitle: Limit revenue based on photomonitoring to a percentage of total
items.longtitle: To amend section 4511.093 of the Revised Code to prohibit a local authority from deriving more than 30 per cent of the total annual revenue of the local authority from the issuance of tickets for traffic law violations based on evidence recorded by traffic law photo-monitoring devices.

items.name: H. B. No. 209
items.shorttitle: Limit tickets based on photomonitoring to ratio of population
items.longtitle: To amend section 4511.093 of the Revised Code to prohibit a local authority, in any year, from issuing a total number of traffic tickets based on the use of traffic law photo-monitoring devices that exceeds two times the population of the local authority.

items.name: S. B. No. 127
items.shorttitle: Require actions when driver approaches waste collection vehicle
items.longtitle: To amend sections 4511.01, 4511.213, and 4513.17 of the Revised Code to require motor vehicle operators to take certain actions upon approaching a stationary waste collection vehicle collecting refuse on a roadside.

items.name: H. B. No. 213
items.shorttitle: Change appraisers' law and regulate appraisal management
items.longtitle: To amend sections 109.572, 121.08, 4763.01, 4763.02, 4763.03, 4763.05, 4763.08, 4763.11, 4763.12, 4763.13, 4763.14, 4763.15, 4763.17, and 4763.19 and to enact sections 4768.01, 4768.02, 4768.03, 4768.04, 4768.05, 4768.06, 4768.07, 4768.08, 4768.09, 4768.10, 4768.11, 4768.12, 4768.13, 4768.14, 4768.15, and 4768.99 of the Revised Code to change the definition of "appraisal" for purposes of the Real Estate Appraiser Licensing Law, to make changes to certain procedures and the exceptions to licensure under that law, to regulate appraisal management companies, and to declare an emergency.

items.name: H. B. No. 226
items.shorttitle: Regards fireworks, fireworks moratoriums, fees, and sales
items.longtitle: To amend sections 1705.48, 3737.51, 3737.71, 3737.99, 3743.04, 3743.17, 3743.44, 3743.45, 3743.60, 3743.61, 3743.63, 3743.65, 3743.75, 3743.99, 5703.052, 5703.053, 5703.19, 5703.70, and 5703.77 and to enact sections 3737.04, 3737.05, 3737.06, 3737.07, 3737.08, 3737.09, 3737.10, 3737.11, 3737.12, 3743.46, 3743.47, 3743.591, and 3743.67 of the Revised Code to establish a fireworks study group to review and make recommendations regarding the Fireworks Law, to extend to July 1, 2020, the moratorium on issuing fireworks manufacturer and wholesaler licenses, to eliminate, beginning January 1, 2021, the moratorium on geographic transfer of fireworks manufacturer and wholesaler licenses, and, beginning July 1, 2020, to impose a fee on the retail sale of consumer grade fireworks in this state and to expand the ability of individuals to obtain 1.3G display fireworks and obtain and use 1.4G consumer fireworks.

items.name: H. B. No. 198
items.shorttitle: Prohibit accepting credit card for purchase of lottery ticket
items.longtitle: To amend sections 3770.03 and 3770.08 of the Revised Code to prohibit a lottery sales agent from accepting a credit card for the purchase of a lottery ticket.

items.name: S. B. No. 86
items.shorttitle: Designate Ohio National Missing Children's Day
items.longtitle: To enact section 5.291 of the Revised Code to designate the twenty-fifth day of May as "Ohio National Missing Children's Day."

items.name: H. B. No. 244
items.shorttitle: Designate Alzheimer's and Brain Awareness Month
items.longtitle: To enact section 5.236 of the Revised Code to designate the month of June as "Alzheimer's and Brain Awareness Month."

items.name: H. B. No. 203
items.shorttitle: Increase access to youth summer job opportunities
items.longtitle: To enact section 122.043 of the Revised Code to require the Director of Development Services to establish a youth summer jobs pledging initiative to increase access to summer employment opportunities for high school and college youth.

items.name: H. B. No. 147
