items.name: H. B. No. 118
items.shorttitle: Prohibit dismissing tax complaint if fails to identify owner
items.longtitle: To amend section 5715.19 of the Revised Code to expressly prohibit the dismissal of a property tax complaint for failure to correctly identify the property owner.

items.name: H. B. No. 171
items.shorttitle: Limit work hours for emergency medical providers
items.longtitle: To amend section 4113.99 and to enact section 4113.11 of the Revised Code to limit the hours worked in a work shift and to require work breaks for emergency medical service providers.

items.name: S. B. No. 8
items.shorttitle: Establish 1:1 School Facilities Option Program
items.longtitle: To enact section 3318.39 of the Revised Code to establish the 1:1 School Facilities Option Program as an alternative to assist certain school districts in constructing, acquiring, reconstructing, or making additions or repairs to any feature of a classroom facility.
items.version: As Reported by the Senate Education Committee

items.name: S. B. No. 128
items.shorttitle: Address zero-emissions nuclear resource program

items.name: S. B. No. 8
items.shorttitle: Establish 1:1 School Facilities Option Program
items.longtitle: To enact section 3318.39 of the Revised Code to require the Ohio School Facilities Commission to establish a program assisting school districts in purchasing technology and making physical alterations to improve technology infrastructure and school safety and security.

items.name: S. B. No. 4
items.shorttitle: Expand expungement and intervention
items.longtitle: To amend sections 2951.041 and 2953.38 and to enact section 2953.521 of the Revised Code to allow a person who is found not guilty of an offense or who is the defendant named in a dismissed criminal charge to apply for a court order to expunge the person's official records in the case if the charge or not guilty finding was the result of the applicant having been a human trafficking victim; to allow a person convicted of certain prostitution-related offenses to apply for the expungement of the conviction record of any offense, other than a specified disqualifying offense, the person's participation in which was a result of having been a human trafficking victim; and to allow intervention in lieu of conviction for persons charged with committing an offense while a victim of compelling prostitution.
items.version: As Reported by the Senate Judiciary Committee

items.name: H. B. No. 52
items.shorttitle: Regulate solicitation of certain deeds
items.longtitle: To amend section 1345.99 and to enact section 1345.023 of the Revised Code to regulate the solicitation of certain deeds.

items.name: S. B. No. 7
items.shorttitle: Know of protection order if actual knowledge
items.longtitle: To amend section 2919.27 of the Revised Code to provide that service of a protection order or consent agreement upon a person is not necessary for the person to be convicted of the offense of violating a protection order if the person had actual notice of the order or agreement and the person recklessly violated its terms.

items.name: S. B. No. 62
items.shorttitle: Designate Harrison Dillard Day
items.longtitle: To enact section 5.236 of the Revised Code to designate July 8 as "Harrison Dillard Day."

items.name: S. B. No. 3
items.shorttitle: Review workforce development laws

items.name: H. B. No. 38
items.shorttitle: Increase penalty for murder or assault of certain persons
items.longtitle: To amend sections 2903.01, 2903.11, and 2929.14 of the Revised Code to provide that purposely causing the death of a first responder or military member is aggravated murder and to require an offender to serve the prison term imposed for felonious assault on a peace officer, investigator, first responder, or military member consecutively to the prison term imposed for any related offense.

items.name: H. B. No. 51
items.shorttitle: Review and sunset cabinet departments
items.longtitle: To amend section 117.46 and to enact sections 101.88, 101.881, 101.882, and 101.89 of the Revised Code to require standing committees of the General Assembly to establish a schedule for the periodic review and sunset of state departments that are currently in the Governor's cabinet, and to require that Auditor of State performance audits be scheduled to coincide with the periodic review.

items.name: H. B. No. 134
items.shorttitle: Allow community improvement grants outside county to schools
items.longtitle: To amend sections 307.283 and 5739.026 of the Revised Code to allow community improvements board grants to a school district to be spent for permanent improvements outside the county so long as the improvements are within the school district.

items.name: H. B. No. 135
items.shorttitle: Designate Superman Day
items.longtitle: To enact section 5.49 of the Revised Code to designate June 12th as "Superman Day."

items.name: S. B. No. 25
items.shorttitle: Create new municipal court
items.longtitle: To amend sections 1901.01, 1901.02, 1901.03, 1901.07, 1901.08, 1901.31, 1901.312, 1901.34, and 1907.11 of the Revised Code and to amend Section 729.10 of Am. Sub. H.B. 483 of the 130th General Assembly, as subsequently amended, to create the Perry County Municipal Court in New Lexington on January 1, 2018, to establish one full-time judgeship in that court, to provide for the nomination of the judge by petition only, to abolish the Perry County County Court on that date, to designate the Perry County Clerk of Courts as the clerk of the Perry County Municipal Court, to provide for the election for the Perry County Municipal Court of one full-time judge in 2017, to modify the provisions regarding the membership of the Criminal Justice Recodification Committee, and to declare an emergency.

items.name: S. B. No. 25
items.longtitle: To amend sections 1901.01, 1901.02, 1901.03, 1901.07, 1901.08, 1901.31, 1901.312, 1901.34, and 1907.11 of the Revised Code and to amend Section 729.10 of Am. Sub. H.B. 483 of the 130th General Assembly, as subsequently amended, to create the Perry County Municipal Court in New Lexington on January 1, 2018, to establish one full-time judgeship in that court, to provide for the nomination of the judge by petition only, to abolish the Perry County County Court on that date, to designate the Perry County Clerk of Courts as the clerk of the Perry County Municipal Court, to provide for the election for the Perry County Municipal Court of one full-time judge in 2017, to modify the provisions regarding the membership of the Criminal Justice Recodification Committee, and to declare an emergency.
items.version: As Reported by the Senate Judiciary Committee

items.name: S. B. No. 36
items.shorttitle: Specify how value of agricultural land is computed
items.longtitle: To amend sections 5713.31, 5713.34, and 5715.01 of the Revised Code to require that the computation of the capitalization rate for the purposes of determining CAUV of agricultural land be computed using a method that excludes appreciation and equity buildup and to stipulate that CAUV land used for a conservation practice or enrolled in a federal land retirement or conservation program for at least three years must be valued at the lowest of the values assigned on the basis of soil type.

items.name: H. B. No. 68
items.shorttitle: Prohibit certain sexual conduct involving an impaired person
items.longtitle: To amend sections 2903.33, 2903.34, 2907.08, 2907.321, 2907.322, 2907.323, and 2929.13 of the Revised Code to include an impaired person as a potential victim of voyeurism, to include conduct involving an impaired person within the offenses of pandering obscenity involving a minor, pandering sexually oriented matter involving a minor, and illegal use of a minor in a nudity-oriented material or performance, and to prohibit an owner, operator, administrator, or employee of a care facility from creating, sharing, reproducing, or publishing any image of a care facility resident without a proper purpose and without prior written consent from the resident.

items.name: H. B. No. 142
items.shorttitle: Eliminate need when stopped to notify carrying firearm
items.longtitle: To amend sections 2923.12, 2923.126, 2923.128, and 2923.16 of the Revised Code to eliminate the requirement that a concealed handgun licensee notify a law enforcement officer that the licensee is carrying a concealed handgun when stopped.

items.name: H. B. No. 42
items.shorttitle: Prohibit installation of unsafe used tires
items.longtitle: To amend section 1345.99 and to enact section 1345.022 of the Revised Code to prohibit the installation of unsafe used tires on certain motor vehicles.
items.version: As Reported by the House Economic Development, Commerce, and Labor Committee

items.name: H. B. No. 128
items.shorttitle: Makes changes relating to building inspections
items.longtitle: To amend sections 121.083 and 3781.10 and to enact sections 3781.181 and 3781.182 of the Revised Code to permit a general contractor or owner of specified buildings to enter into a contract with a third-party private inspector or a certified building department for building inspection and to make other changes relating to building inspections.

items.name: S. B. No. 70
items.shorttitle: Amend child support laws

items.name: H. B. No. 105
items.shorttitle: Limit revenue credited to Oil and Gas Well Fund and divert excess
items.longtitle: To amend sections 1509.02, 1509.071, 1509.11, and 5749.02 and to enact sections 321.50, 321.51, 321.52, 505.96, 1509.075, 3737.15, and 3745.60 of the Revised Code to limit the amount of revenue that may be credited to the Oil and Gas Well Fund and to allocate funds in excess of that amount to local governments, fire departments, and a grant program to encourage compressed natural gas as a motor vehicle fuel.

items.name: H. B. No. 164
items.shorttitle: Require licensing of commercial roofing contractors
items.longtitle: To amend sections 715.27, 3781.102, 4740.01, 4740.02, 4740.04, and 4740.12 of the Revised Code to require commercial roofing contractors to have a license.

items.name: H. B. No. 116
items.shorttitle: Exempt optical aids from sales tax
items.longtitle: To amend sections 5739.01 and 5739.02 of the Revised Code to exempt prescription eyeglasses, contact lenses, and other optical aids sold by licensed dispensers from sales and use tax beginning July 2019.
items.version: As Reported by the House Ways and Means Committee

items.name: S. B. No. 147
items.shorttitle: Grant tax credit to insurers if invest in rural business growth
items.longtitle: To amend sections 5725.98 and 5729.98 and to enact sections 122.15, 122.151, 122.152, 122.153, and 122.154 of the Revised Code to enact the "Ohio Rural Jobs Act" which authorizes a nonrefundable tax credit for insurance companies that invest in rural business growth funds, which are certified to provide capital to rural and agricultural businesses.

items.name: H. B. No. 56
items.shorttitle: Expunge criminal record if caused by human trafficking
items.longtitle: To amend sections 2951.041 and 2953.38 and to enact section 2953.521 of the Revised Code to permit a person who is found not guilty or is the defendant in a dismissed case to apply for an expungement of the person's records in the case if the complaint, indictment, or finding of not guilty resulted from the applicant having been a victim of human trafficking, to permit a person convicted of certain prostitution-related offenses to apply for the expungement of any record of conviction of an offense, with certain exceptions, if the person's participation in the offense was a result of having been a victim of human trafficking, and to authorize intervention in lieu of conviction for persons charged with committing an offense while a victim of compelling prostitution.

items.name: H. B. No. 155
items.shorttitle: Grant tax credit for training commercial vehicle operator
items.longtitle: To amend sections 5747.98 and 5751.98 and to enact sections 122.91, 5747.82, and 5751.55 of the Revised Code to authorize a tax credit for expenses incurred by an employer to train a commercial vehicle operator.

items.name: S. B. No. 36
items.shorttitle: Specify how value of agricultural land is computed
items.longtitle: To amend sections 5713.31, 5713.34, and 5715.01 of the Revised Code to require that the computation of the capitalization rate for the purposes of determining CAUV of agricultural land be computed using a method that excludes appreciation and equity buildup and to stipulate that CAUV land used for a conservation practice or enrolled in a federal land retirement or conservation program for at least three years must be valued at the lowest of the values assigned on the basis of soil type.
items.version: As Reported by the Senate Ways and Means Committee

items.name: H. B. No. 186
items.shorttitle: Grant tax deduction for certain higher education expenses
items.longtitle: To amend section 5747.01 and to enact section 5747.82 of the Revised Code to enact the "Blair Deduction" to allow an individual obtaining a post-secondary degree or credential from an eligible educational institution to claim an income tax deduction for qualified higher education expenses.

items.name: S. B. No. 33
items.shorttitle: Disclose law enforcement data to defendant
items.longtitle: To amend sections 2913.04 and 2923.129 and to enact section 5503.101 of the Revised Code to allow disclosure of information from the law enforcement automated data system (LEADS) to a defendant in a traffic or criminal case.

items.name: H. B. No. 196
items.shorttitle: Designate Chiropractic Awareness Month
items.longtitle: To enact section 5.2518 of the Revised Code to designate October as "Ohio Chiropractic Awareness Month."

items.name: H. B. No. 173
items.shorttitle: Count home-based employees for job creation tax credit
items.longtitle: To amend section 122.17 of the Revised Code to provide that compensation paid to certain home-based employees may be counted for purposes of an employer qualifying for and complying with the terms of a Job Creation Tax Credit.

items.name: S. B. No. 114
items.shorttitle: Grant tax credit for training commercial vehicle operator
items.longtitle: To amend sections 5747.98 and 5751.98 and to enact sections 122.91, 5747.82, and 5751.55 of the Revised Code to authorize a tax credit for expenses incurred by an employer to train a commercial vehicle operator.

items.name: H. B. No. 122
items.shorttitle: Study regional economic development alliances
items.longtitle: To establish a Regional Economic Development Alliance Study Committee to study the benefits and challenges involved in creating regional economic development alliances.
items.version: As Reported by the House State and Local Government Committee

items.name: S. B. No. 138
items.shorttitle: Regulate body cavity and strip searches; limit lawsuits regarding
items.longtitle: To amend section 2933.32 of the Revised Code to authorize a corrections officer to cause a body cavity search to be conducted, to establish separate rules and restrictions for conducting strip searches, and to limit the right of any person to commence a civil action for a violation of the law governing body cavity searches and strip searches to violations related to body cavity searches.

items.name: H. B. No. 143
items.shorttitle: Clarify definition of electric distribution company for tax
items.longtitle: To amend section 5727.80 of the Revised Code to clarify the definition of "electric distribution company" for kilowatt-hour tax purposes.

items.name: H. B. No. 165
items.shorttitle: Designate Congenital Cytomegalovirus Awareness Month
items.longtitle: To enact section 5.2518 of the Revised Code to designate May as "Congenital Cytomegalovirus Awareness Month."
items.version: As Reported by the House Health Committee

items.name: H. B. No. 101
items.shorttitle: Improve access to epinephrine
items.longtitle: To amend sections 3728.03, 4729.16, 4729.99, and 4731.96 and to enact sections 3707.60, 4729.382, 4729.46, and 4731.961 of the Revised Code to authorize an epinephrine autoinjector substitution when a prescription is filled or refilled, to authorize epinephrine to be dispensed without a prescription under a physician-established protocol, and to declare the act the "Epinephrine Accessibility Act."
items.version: As Reported by the House Health Committee

items.name: H. B. No. 118
items.shorttitle: Prohibit dismissing tax complaint if fails to identify owner
items.longtitle: To amend section 5715.19 of the Revised Code to expressly prohibit the dismissal of a property tax complaint for failure to correctly identify the property owner.
items.version: As Reported by the House Ways and Means Committee

items.name: H. B. No. 28
items.shorttitle: Creates FY 2018-2019 Industrial Commission budget
items.longtitle:
To make appropriations for the Industrial Commission for the biennium beginning July 1, 2017, and ending June 30, 2019, and to provide authorization and conditions for the operation of Commission
programs.
items.version: As Reported by the House Finance Committee
items.local_impact_statement: No - Not required for budget bills

items.name: S. B. No. 123
items.shorttitle: Limit right to initiate property tax complaints
items.longtitle: To amend sections 307.699, 3735.67, 5715.19, 5715.27, and 5717.01 of the Revised Code to limit the right to initiate most types of property tax complaints to the property owner and the county recorder of the county in which the property is located.

items.name: S. B. No. 4
items.shorttitle: Expand expungement and intervention
items.longtitle: To amend sections 2951.041 and 2953.38 and to enact section 2953.521 of the Revised Code to allow a person who is found not guilty of an offense or who is the defendant named in a dismissed criminal charge to apply for a court order to expunge the person's official records in the case if the charge or not guilty finding was the result of the applicant having been a human trafficking victim, to allow a person convicted of certain prostitution-related offenses to apply for the expungement of the conviction record of any offense, other than a specified disqualifying offense, the person's participation in which was a result of having been a human trafficking victim, and to allow intervention in lieu of conviction for persons charged with committing an offense while a victim of compelling prostitution.

items.name: H. B. No. 69
items.shorttitle: Reimburse medical service levy revenue forgone because of TIF
items.longtitle: To amend section 5709.40 of the Revised Code to require reimbursement of certain township fire and emergency medical service levy revenue forgone because of the creation of a municipal tax increment financing district.

items.name: S. B. No. 36
items.shorttitle: Specify how value of agricultural land is computed
items.longtitle: To amend sections 5713.31, 5713.34, and 5715.01 of the Revised Code to require that the computation of the capitalization rate for the purposes of determining CAUV of agricultural land be computed using a method that excludes appreciation and equity buildup and to stipulate that CAUV land used for a conservation practice or enrolled in a federal land retirement or conservation program for at least three years must be valued at the lowest of the values assigned on the basis of soil type.

items.name: H. B. No. 122
items.shorttitle: Study regional economic development alliances
items.longtitle: To establish a Regional Economic Development Alliance Study Committee to study the benefits and challenges involved in creating regional economic development alliances.

items.name: H. B. No. 104
items.shorttitle: Allow vendors to receive sales tax refunds for certain bad debts
items.longtitle: To amend section 5739.121 of the Revised Code to allow vendors to receive a refund of sales tax remitted for bad debts on private label credit accounts when the debt is charged off as uncollectible by the credit account lender.
items.version: As Reported by the House Financial Institutions, Housing, and Urban Development Committee

items.name: H. B. No. 2
items.shorttitle: Modify civil rights law relating to employment
items.longtitle: To amend sections 2315.18, 4112.01, 4112.02, 4112.04, 4112.05, 4112.051, 4112.08, and 4112.99; to amend, for the purpose of adopting new section numbers as indicated in parentheses, sections 4112.051 (4112.055) and 4112.052 (4112.056); to enact new sections 4112.051, 4112.052 and sections 4112.053 and 4112.054; and to repeal section 4112.14 of the Revised Code to modify Ohio civil rights laws related to employment.

items.name: S. B. No. 88
items.shorttitle: Modify financial planning and supervision commission laws
items.longtitle: To amend sections 118.05, 118.06, 118.11, 118.12, 118.13, and 118.99 and to repeal the version of section 118.023 of the Revised Code that is scheduled to take effect September 29, 2017, to modify the composition and powers of the financial planning and supervision commission of a political subdivision that is in a state of fiscal emergency and to clarify the duties of that political subdivision.

items.name: S. B. No. 6
items.shorttitle: Continue Bridge Partnership Program
items.longtitle: To enact section 5501.491 of the Revised Code to extend the Ohio Bridge Partnership Program through the end of fiscal year 2019 and to require the Director of Transportation to submit a report to the Governor, Senate, and House of Representatives recommending ways to continue to fund the program.

items.name: S. B. No. 1
items.shorttitle: Revise drug laws
items.longtitle: To amend sections 2925.01, 2925.02, 2925.03, 2925.04, 2925.05, 2925.11, 2925.13, 2925.36, 2929.01, 2929.13, 2929.14, 2941.1410, 3719.41, 3719.99, and 4729.99 of the Revised Code to increase penalties for drug trafficking violations, drug possession violations, and aggravated funding of drug trafficking when the drug involved in the offense is a fentanyl-related compound, except for drug possession violations when the fentanyl-related compound is combined with marihuana or a Schedule III, IV, or V controlled substance and the total amount of the combination drug is less than 40 unit doses or 4 grams and the offender did not know of the fentanyl content; to revise the manner of determining sentence for certain violations of the offense of permitting drug abuse; and to add lisdexamfetamine to the list of schedule II controlled substances.

items.name: H. B. No. 139
items.shorttitle: Eliminate public records exemption if record 100 years old
items.longtitle: To amend section 149.43 of the Revised Code to eliminate the public disclosure exemption for any permanently retained record 100 years after the date of its creation.

items.name: H. B. No. 178
items.shorttitle: Address zero-emissions nuclear resource program

items.name: H. B. No. 92
items.shorttitle: Require public indecency before minors offenders to register
items.longtitle: To amend sections 2907.09 and 2950.01 of the Revised Code to require an offender who knowingly commits the offense of public indecency under certain circumstances involving exposure of private parts likely to be viewed by minors and for the purpose of sexual arousal or gratification to register as a Tier I sex offender/child-victim offender.

items.name: H. B. No. 175
items.shorttitle: Allow residence owners to keep small livestock on property
items.longtitle: To amend sections 303.21 and 519.21 and to enact section 901.60 of the Revised Code to allow an owner of residential property to keep, harbor, breed, or maintain small livestock on the property, and to prohibit zoning authorities from regulating certain agricultural activities conducted on residential property for noncommercial purposes.

items.name: H. B. No. 163
items.shorttitle: Allow subdivisions elect to apply Prevailing Wage Law
items.longtitle: To amend sections 164.07, 307.022, 307.671, 307.673, 307.674, 307.696, 351.06, 353.03, 1506.44, 1710.02, 4115.03, 4115.04, 4115.06, 5540.03, 6117.012, and 6121.061 of the Revised Code to allow political subdivisions, special districts, and state institutions of higher education to elect to apply the Prevailing Wage Law to public improvement projects.

items.name: H. B. No. 93
items.shorttitle: Require presidential candidates to reveal tax returns
items.longtitle: To amend sections 111.241, 3505.10, 3513.041, 3513.257, and 3513.31 and to enact section 3505.101 of the Revised Code to require a candidate for President or Vice-President of the United States to submit copies of the candidate's five most recent federal income tax returns for publication on the Secretary of State's official web site.

items.name: S. B. No. 142
items.shorttitle: Expand right to concealed carry
items.longtitle: To amend sections 109.69, 109.731, 1547.69, 2923.11, 2923.12, 2923.121, 2923.122, 2923.123, 2923.124, 2923.125, 2923.126, 2923.128, 2923.129, 2923.1210, 2923.1213, 2923.16, and 4749.10 and to enact section 2923.111 of the Revised Code to allow a concealed handgun licensee to carry concealed all firearms other than dangerous ordnance or firearms that state or federal law prohibits the person from possessing and to provide that a person 21 years of age or older and not prohibited by federal law from possessing or receiving a firearm does not need a concealed handgun license in order to carry or have a concealed firearm and is subject to the same laws regarding concealed firearm carrying as a concealed handgun licensee.

items.name: H. B. No. 81
items.shorttitle: Prohibit death sentence if have serious mental illness
items.longtitle: To amend sections 2929.02, 2929.022, 2929.024, 2929.03, 2929.04, 2929.06, 2953.21, and 2953.23 and to enact section 2929.025 of the Revised Code to provide that a person convicted of aggravated murder who shows that the person had a serious mental illness at the time of committing the offense cannot be sentenced to death for the offense and to provide a mechanism for resentencing to a life sentence a person previously sentenced to death who proves that the person had a serious mental illness at the time of committing the offense.

items.name: H. B. No. 162
items.shorttitle: Grant tax credit for sound recording production or infrastructure
items.longtitle: To amend section 5747.98 and to enact sections 122.851 and 5747.67 of the Revised Code to authorize a refundable income tax credit for individual investors in a sound recording production company equal to a portion of the company's costs for a recording production or recording infrastructure project in Ohio.

items.name: H. B. No. 144
items.shorttitle: Require actions when driver approaches waste collection vehicle
items.longtitle: To amend sections 4511.01, 4511.213, and 4513.17 of the Revised Code to require motor vehicle operators to take certain actions upon approaching a stationary waste collection vehicle collecting refuse on a roadside.

items.name: H. B. No. 44
items.shorttitle: Designate an appreciation day
items.longtitle: To enact section 5.261 of the Revised Code to designate May 24 as First Responders' Appreciation Day.

items.name: S. B. No. 141
items.shorttitle: Create Paulding County Municipal Court
items.longtitle: To amend sections 1901.01, 1901.02, 1901.03, 1901.07, 1901.08, 1901.31, 1901.312, 1901.34, and 1907.11 of the Revised Code to create the Paulding County Municipal Court in Paulding on January 1, 2019, to establish one full-time judgeship in that court, to provide for the nomination of the judge by petition only, to abolish the Paulding County County Court on that date, to designate the Paulding County Clerk of Courts as the clerk of the Paulding County Municipal Court, and to provide for the election for the Paulding County Municipal Court of one full-time judge in 2018.

items.name: H. B. No. 94
items.shorttitle: Designate Teen Dating Violence Awareness Month
items.longtitle: To enact section 5.2516 of the Revised Code to designate February as "Teen Dating Violence Awareness Month."

items.name: H. B. No. 45
items.shorttitle: Designate an awareness month
items.longtitle: To enact section 5.259 of the Revised Code to designate May as "Neurofibromatosis Awareness Month."

items.name: S. B. No. 140
items.shorttitle: Create programs for workforce needs and economic development
items.longtitle: To create the Public-Private Partnership Grant Program for fiscal years 2018 and 2019 to develop, enhance, and promote educational programs to address regional workforce needs; to create the Sector Partnership Grant Program for fiscal years 2018 and 2019 to identify and provide grants to industry partnerships; to support programs that improve access to workforce training opportunities for students; to support economic development and revitalization programs; and to make an appropriation.

items.name: S. B. No. 137
items.shorttitle: Designate Judge Robert Duncan Memorial Hwy
items.longtitle: To enact section 5534.79 of the Revised Code to designate a portion of the eastbound lanes of I-70 in Franklin County as the "Judge Robert Duncan Memorial Highway."

items.name: S. B. No. 136
items.shorttitle: Designate G Thomas Turner Sr I-70 East Entrance Ramp
items.longtitle: To enact section 5534.90 of the Revised Code to designate the entrance ramp from West Broad Street onto Interstate Highway 70 in Franklin County as the "G. Thomas Turner, Sr. I-70 East Entrance Ramp."

items.name: S. B. No. 62
items.shorttitle: Designate Harrison Dillard Day
items.longtitle: To enact section 5.236 of the Revised Code to designate July 8 as "Harrison Dillard Day."
items.version: As Reported by the Senate Government Oversight and Reform Committee

items.name: S. B. No. 32
items.shorttitle: Narrow scope of speedy trial rules
items.longtitle: To amend sections 2945.71 and 2945.73 of the Revised Code to provide a prosecutor an additional fourteen days to commence a trial after a person charged with a felony has been discharged because the person has not been brought to trial within the required amount of time and to authorize the court to release the person from detention in connection with those charges pending trial.
items.version: As Reported by the Senate Judiciary Committee

items.name: H. B. No. 101
items.shorttitle: Improve access to epinephrine
items.longtitle: To amend sections 4729.16, 4729.99, and 4731.96 and to enact sections 3707.60, 4729.382, 4729.46, and 4731.961 of the Revised Code to authorize an epinephrine autoinjector substitution when a prescription is filled or refilled, to authorize epinephrine to be dispensed without a prescription under a physician-established protocol, and to declare the act the "Epinephrine Accessibility Act."

items.name: H. B. No. 165
items.shorttitle: Designate Congenital Cytomegalovirus Awareness Month
items.longtitle: To enact section 5.2518 of the Revised Code to designate May as "Congenital Cytomegalovirus Awareness Month."

items.name: H. B. No. 66
items.shorttitle: Require tenured faculty to teach minimum load
items.longtitle: To amend section 3345.45 and to enact section 3345.451 of the Revised Code to require permanently tenured state university or college faculty members to teach at least three credit hours of undergraduate courses per semester.

items.name: H. B. No. 49
items.shorttitle: Creates FY 2018-2019 operating budget
items.version: As Reported by the House Finance Committee
items.local_impact_statement: No - Not required for budget bills

items.name: H. B. No. 124
items.shorttitle: Submit renewal tax levy to disenfranchised voters
items.longtitle: To authorize a joint vocational school district to submit the question of a renewal tax levy to voters who did not have an opportunity to vote on the levy at an election held in November of 2015 because the levy was only placed on the ballot in one of several counties in which the district has territory.

items.name: S. B. No. 21
items.shorttitle: Reduce minimum poll workers and eliminate mailings
items.longtitle: To amend sections 3501.22 and 3503.21 of the Revised Code to reduce the minimum number of precinct election officials in a precinct in which electronic pollbooks are used and to eliminate the requirement that a board of elections send a notice to a person's residence address when the board cancels the person's voter registration because it received a report of the person's death.

items.name: H. B. No. 149
items.shorttitle: Expand crime of abortion trafficking
items.longtitle: To amend sections 2108.18 and 2919.14 of the Revised Code to expand the crime of abortion trafficking and to increase the penalty.

items.name: S. B. No. 135
items.shorttitle: Implement voting machine acquisition program
items.longtitle: To make supplemental operating appropriations for the FY 2018-FY 2019 biennium and supplemental capital appropriations for the FY 2017-FY 2018 biennium to implement a voting machine and equipment acquisition program.

items.name: S. B. No. 89
items.shorttitle: Establish standards for lighting rail yards
items.longtitle: To amend sections 4907.01 and 4907.99 and to enact sections 4907.70 and 4907.71 of the Revised Code to establish standards for lighting in a rail yard and to establish penalties for railroad companies that are in violation of those standards.

items.name: H. B. No. 141
items.shorttitle: Cause death when provide drugs involuntary manslaughter
items.longtitle: To amend sections 2903.04, 2903.06, 2919.22, 2929.142, 4510.17, 4510.31, and 4511.181 of the Revised Code to provide that causing or contributing to the death of another person as a result of the offender's sale, distribution, dispensation, or administration of a controlled substance or controlled substance analog is a violation of the offense of involuntary manslaughter and to make this offense a strict liability offense.

items.name: H. B. No. 136
items.shorttitle: Designate David Sexton and Glen Millinger Memorial Highways
items.longtitle: To enact sections 5534.802 and 5534.803 of the Revised Code to designate a portion of State Route 61 in Erie County as the "SGT David Sexton Memorial Highway" and a portion of Benton-Carroll Road in Ottawa County as "SGT Glen Millinger Memorial Highway."
items.version: As Reported by the House Transportation and Public Safety Committee

items.name: H. B. No. 140
items.shorttitle: Designate Danny Raymond King Memorial Highway
items.longtitle: To enact section 5534.78 of the Revised Code to designate a portion of State Route 32 in Brown and Highland Counties as the "Army Specialist Danny Raymond King Memorial Highway."
items.version: As Reported by the House Transportation and Public Safety Committee

items.name: H. B. No. 179
items.shorttitle: Cooperate in enforcing federal immigration laws
items.longtitle: To amend sections 9.63 and 5747.502 and to enact sections 9.631, 9.632, and 9.633 of the Revised Code to require state and local authorities to cooperate with the federal government in the enforcement of immigration laws, to prohibit a local government that fails to do so from receiving certain state funds, to provide for the removal of officers of a local government that fails to do so, and to declare an emergency.

items.name: H. B. No. 172
items.shorttitle: Modify law governing access to patient medical records
items.longtitle: To amend section 3701.74 of the Revised Code to modify the laws governing access to a patient's medical records.

items.name: H. B. No. 167
items.shorttitle: Address opioid prescribing and addiction treatment
items.longtitle: To amend sections 4715.302, 4729.75, 4729.77, 4729.79, 4731.052, and 4731.055 and to enact sections 4715.303, 4731.058, 4731.059, and 5119.373 of the Revised Code regarding addiction treatment and opioid prescribing by physicians and dentists.

items.name: H. B. No. 157
items.shorttitle: Change funeral services law

items.name: H. B. No. 61
items.shorttitle: Exempt feminine hygiene products from sales tax
items.longtitle: To amend section 5739.02 of the Revised Code to exempt from sales tax the sale of tampons and other feminine hygiene products associated with menstruation.

items.name: S. B. No. 57
items.shorttitle: Designate Diffuse Intrinsic Pontine Glioma Awareness Day
items.longtitle: To enact section 5.291 of the Revised Code to designate the seventeenth day of May as "Diffuse Intrinsic Pontine Glioma Awareness Day."
items.version: As Reported by the House Health Committee

items.name: S. B. No. 18
items.shorttitle: Designate a commemorative day
items.longtitle: To enact section 5.291 of the Revised Code to designate September 12 as "Jesse Owens Day."
items.version: As Reported by the House State and Local Government Committee

items.name: S. B. No. 27
items.shorttitle: Designate a commemorative month
items.longtitle: To amend section 5.2281 of the Revised Code to designate the period beginning March 13 and ending April 15 as "Ohio Deaf History Month."
items.version: As Reported by the House State and Local Government Committee

items.name: S. B. No. 57
items.shorttitle: Designate Diffuse Intrinsic Pontine Glioma Awareness Day
items.longtitle: To enact section 5.291 of the Revised Code to designate the seventeenth day of May as "Diffuse Intrinsic Pontine Glioma Awareness Day."

items.name: H. B. No. 103
items.shorttitle: Modify financial planning and supervision commission laws
items.longtitle: To amend sections 118.05, 118.06, 118.11, 118.12, 118.13, and 118.99 and to repeal the version of section 118.023 of the Revised Code that is scheduled to take effect September 29, 2017, to modify the composition and powers of the financial planning and supervision commission of a political subdivision that is in a state of fiscal emergency and to clarify the duties of that political subdivision.

items.name: H. B. No. 140
items.shorttitle: Designate Danny Raymond King Memorial Highway
items.longtitle: To enact section 5534.78 of the Revised Code to designate a portion of State Route 32 in Brown and Highland Counties as the "Army Specialist Danny Raymond King Memorial Highway."

items.name: H. B. No. 136
items.shorttitle: Designate David Sexton and Glen Millinger Memorial Highways
items.longtitle: To enact sections 5534.802 and 5534.803 of the Revised Code to designate a portion of State Route 61 in Erie County as the "SGT David Sexton Memorial Highway" and a portion of Benton-Carroll Road in Ottawa County as "SGT Glen Millinger Memorial Highway."

items.name: H. B. No. 126
items.shorttitle: Require region-based kinship caregiver navigator program
items.longtitle: To amend sections 5101.80, 5101.85, 5101.851, and 5101.853; to amend, for the purpose of adopting new section numbers as indicated in parentheses, sections 5101.852 (5101.856) and 5101.853 (5101.854); and to enact new sections 5101.852 and 5101.853 and section 5101.855 of the Revised Code to require a region-based kinship caregiver navigator program.

items.name: S. B. No. 90
items.shorttitle: Establish standards for walkways in rail yards
items.longtitle: To amend sections 4907.01 and 4907.99 and to enact sections 4907.70 and 4907.71 of the Revised Code to establish standards for walkways in a rail yard and to establish penalties for railroad companies that are in violation of those standards.

items.name: S. B. No. 74
items.shorttitle: Require two-person crews on freight trains
items.longtitle: To enact section 4999.09 of the Revised Code to require the crews of freight trains to consist of at least two individuals.

items.name: H. B. No. 115
items.shorttitle: Create register of persons having a communication disability
items.longtitle: To enact sections 3304.23 and 5502.08 of the Revised Code to establish a database of persons who voluntarily register as being diagnosed with a communication disability or who voluntarily register a minor child or ward as the parents or guardians of such persons for purposes of law enforcement notification.

items.name: S. B. No. 23
items.shorttitle: Designate an awareness day
items.longtitle: To enact section 5.2510 of the Revised Code to designate January 31 as "Omphalocele Awareness Day."

items.name: S. B. No. 96
items.shorttitle: Address Nutrition Assistance and Medicaid benefits
items.longtitle: To amend sections 5101.47 and 5101.54 and to enact sections 5162.137 and 5163.04 of the Revised Code regarding eligibility and benefits under the Supplemental Nutrition Assistance program and the Medicaid program.

items.name: H. B. No. 84
items.shorttitle: Designate June as Ohio Goes Boating Month
items.longtitle: To enact section 5.47 of the Revised Code to designate June as "Ohio Goes Boating Month."

items.name: H. B. No. 114
items.shorttitle: Revise energy efficiency provisions
items.longtitle: To amend sections 4928.01, 4928.142, 4928.143, 4928.20, 4928.61, 4928.62, 4928.64, 4928.641, 4928.643, 4928.644, 4928.645, 4928.65, 4928.66, 4928.662, 4928.6610, 4928.6611, and 5727.75 and to enact sections 4928.647, 4928.664, 4928.665, 4928.666, 4928.667, 4928.6620, and 4928.6621 of the Revised Code and to amend Section 257.80 of Am. Sub. H.B. 64 of the 132nd General Assembly and to repeal Sections 5, 6, 7, 8, 9, 10, and 11 of Sub. S.B. 310 of the 130th General Assembly to revise the provisions governing renewable energy, energy efficiency, and peak demand reduction and to alter funding allocations under the Home Energy Assistance Program.
items.version: As Reported by the House Public Utilities Committee

items.name: S. B. No. 133
items.shorttitle: Report student discipline for violent behavior
items.longtitle: To amend section 3301.0714 of the Revised Code to require the Education Management Information System to include information regarding persons at whom a student's violent behavior that resulted in discipline was directed and to require the Department of Education to submit a one-time report to the General Assembly regarding that information.

items.name: S. B. No. 130
items.shorttitle: Add judges to Franklin County Domestic Relations Division
items.longtitle: To amend sections 2301.02 and 2301.03 of the Revised Code to add two judges to the Domestic Relations Division of the Franklin County Court of Common Pleas to be elected in 2018.

items.name: S. B. No. 129
items.shorttitle: Change cosmetology licensing law

items.name: S. B. No. 126
items.shorttitle: Prohibit health professionals from using conversion therapy
items.longtitle: To enact sections 4723.93, 4731.92, 4732.34, 4743.09, and 4757.46 of the Revised Code to prohibit certain health care professionals from engaging in conversion therapy when treating minor patients.

items.name: S. B. No. 125
items.shorttitle: Changes in child support laws

items.name: S. B. No. 124
items.shorttitle: Qualify students in noncredit courses for grants and credit
items.longtitle: To amend sections 3333.122 and 3333.20 and to enact section 3333.166 of the Revised Code to qualify students in noncredit community college and career and technical programs for Ohio College Opportunity Grants and to require the awarding of academic credit for community colleges' career certification programs.

items.name: S. B. No. 122
items.shorttitle: Permit concealed handguns in statehouse and on its grounds
items.longtitle: To amend section 2923.126 of the Revised Code to permit concealed handgun licensees to carry concealed handguns in the statehouse and on its grounds.

items.name: S. B. No. 121
items.shorttitle: Include tomosynthesis as part of mammography screening benefits
items.longtitle: To amend sections 1751.62, 3923.52, and 3923.54 of the Revised Code to include tomosynthesis as part of required screening mammography benefits under health insurance policies.

items.name: S. B. No. 118
items.shorttitle: Make safety service workers with PTSD eligible for workers' comp
items.longtitle: To amend sections 4123.01, 4123.026, and 4123.46 and to enact sections 145.364, 742.391, 3309.402, 4123.87, and 5505.182 of the Revised Code to make peace officers, firefighters, and emergency medical workers diagnosed with post-traumatic stress disorder arising from employment without an accompanying physical injury eligible for compensation and benefits under Ohio's Workers' Compensation Law for up to one year and to prohibit such a person from receiving a disability benefit from a state retirement system for post-traumatic stress disorder arising from employment without an accompanying physical injury during the time period the person receives compensation and benefits under the Workers' Compensation Law for the disorder.

items.name: S. B. No. 112
items.shorttitle: Establish Green Infrastructure Fund
items.longtitle: To enact section 164.11 of the Revised Code to establish the green infrastructure fund and to make an appropriation.

items.name: S. B. No. 111
items.shorttitle: Indicate school zones by flashing lights
items.longtitle: To amend section 4511.21 of the Revised Code to require school zones to be indicated by signs equipped with flashing or other lights or that indicate the times during which the restrictive speed limit is enforced, and to make an appropriation.

items.name: S. B. No. 110
items.shorttitle: Require health care workers to wear ID when treating patients
items.longtitle: To enact sections 4715.43, 4723.94, 4725.62, 4729.71, 4730.55, 4731.33, 4732.35, 4734.58, 4743.09, 4753.17, 4755.72, 4757.47, 4758.73, 4759.13, 4760.23, 4761.19, 4762.24, 4765.60, 4773.10, 4774.23, 4778.26, and 4779.35 of the Revised Code to require a health care professional to wear identification when providing care or treatment in the presence of a patient.

items.name: S. B. No. 109
items.shorttitle: Establish Yellow Dot medical information program
items.longtitle: To enact section 5502.59 of the Revised Code to establish the "Yellow Dot" motor vehicle medical information program within the Department of Public Safety.

items.name: S. B. No. 108
items.shorttitle: Designate Pride Month
items.longtitle: To enact section 5.242 of the Revised Code to designate the month of June as "Pride Month."

items.name: S. B. No. 107
items.shorttitle: Issue state identification card to veteran without expiration
items.longtitle: To amend section 4507.52 of the Revised Code to provide that any nondriver identification card that is issued to a veteran who is disabled or blind may be issued without an expiration date.

items.name: S. B. No. 106
items.shorttitle: Prohibit smoking in vehicle if passenger under six
items.longtitle: To enact section 4511.80 of the Revised Code to prohibit smoking in a motor vehicle in which a child under six years of age is a passenger.

items.name: S. B. No. 105
items.shorttitle: Designate Ohio Principals Month
items.longtitle: To enact section 5.2315 of the Revised Code to designate the month of October as "Ohio Principals Month."

items.name: S. B. No. 101
items.shorttitle: Regulate employment and retention practices of certain employers
items.longtitle: To amend sections 121.083 and 121.084 and to enact sections 4119.01, 4119.02, 4119.03, 4119.04, 4119.05, 4119.06, 4119.07, 4119.08, 4119.09, 4119.10, 4119.11, 4119.12, 4119.13, 4119.14, 4119.15, 4119.16, 4119.17, and 4119.18 of the Revised Code to regulate certain employment practices of formula retail establishment employers, food services establishment employers, and contractors and to require the purchaser of a formula retail establishment or food services establishment to retain certain employees of the establishment on transfer of ownership.

items.name: H. B. No. 8
items.shorttitle: Prohibit disclosing injuries to minors in school vehicles
items.longtitle: To amend section 149.43 of the Revised Code to exempt from the Public Records Law certain information concerning a minor that is included in a record related to a traffic accident involving a school vehicle in which the minor was an occupant at the time of the accident.

items.name: S. B. No. 3
items.shorttitle: Review workforce development laws
items.version: As Reported by the Senate Transportation, Commerce and Workforce Committee

items.name: H. B. No. 84
items.shorttitle: Designate June as Ohio Goes Boating Month
items.longtitle: To enact section 5.47 of the Revised Code to designate June as "Ohio Goes Boating Month."
items.version: As Reported by the Senate Energy and Natural Resources Committee

items.name: H. B. No. 41
items.shorttitle: Modify voting procedures
items.longtitle: To amend sections 3503.24, 3505.181, 3505.183, 3505.20, 3505.21, 3509.06, and 3511.11 and to enact section 3509.051 of the Revised Code to modify the law concerning challenges to voter registrations, the appointment of observers, and the procedures for processing absent voter's ballots and for casting absent voter's ballots in person.

items.name: H. B. No. 46
items.shorttitle: Modify qualifications for investing county and library money
items.longtitle: To amend section 135.35 of the Revised Code to modify the qualifications regarding notes eligible for investment of county inactive moneys and money in the public library fund.

items.name: H. B. No. 104
items.shorttitle: Allow vendors to receive sales tax refunds for certain bad debts
items.longtitle: To amend section 5739.121 of the Revised Code to allow vendors to receive a refund of sales tax remitted for bad debts on private label credit accounts when the debt is charged off as uncollectible by the credit account lender.

items.name: H. B. No. 116
items.shorttitle: Exempt optical aids from sales tax
items.longtitle: To amend sections 5739.01 and 5739.02 of the Revised Code to exempt prescription eyeglasses, contact lenses, and other optical aids sold by licensed dispensers from sales and use tax.

items.name: H. B. No. 118
items.shorttitle: Prohibit dismissing tax complaint if fails to identify owner
items.longtitle: To amend section 5715.19 of the Revised Code to expressly prohibit the dismissal of a property tax complaint for failure to correctly identify the property owner.

items.name: H. B. No. 64
items.shorttitle: Expunge if criminal sanction based on mistaken identity
items.longtitle: To amend sections 2953.51, 2953.52, 2953.53, 2953.54, 2953.55, and 2953.61 of the Revised Code to provide for the expungement of official records related to the apprehension, arrest, criminal charging, or trial of a person based on mistaken identity.

items.name: H. B. No. 83
items.shorttitle: Designate Carl and Louis Stokes Opportunity Corridor
items.longtitle: To enact section 5534.56 of the Revised Code to designate the planned boulevard known as the Opportunity Corridor within Cleveland as the "Carl and Louis Stokes Opportunity Corridor."

items.name: S. B. No. 18
items.shorttitle: Designate a commemorative day
items.longtitle: To enact section 5.291 of the Revised Code to designate September 12 as "Jesse Owens Day."

items.name: S. B. No. 27
items.shorttitle: Designate a commemorative month
items.longtitle: To amend section 5.2281 of the Revised Code to designate the period beginning March 13 and ending April 15 as "Ohio Deaf History Month."

items.name: H. B. No. 94
items.shorttitle: Designate Teen Dating Violence Awareness Month
items.longtitle: To enact section 5.2516 of the Revised Code to designate February as "Teen Dating Violence Awareness Month."
items.version: As Reported by the House State and Local Government Committee

items.name: H. B. No. 45
items.shorttitle: Designate an awareness month
items.longtitle: To enact section 5.259 of the Revised Code to designate May as "Neurofibromatosis Awareness Month."
items.version: As Reported by the House Health Committee

items.name: H. B. No. 18
items.shorttitle: Eliminate certain elections to fill Congressional vacancies
items.longtitle: To amend sections 3513.301 and 3513.312 of the Revised Code to eliminate the requirement of holding a special election to fill a vacancy in a party nomination for the office of representative to Congress under certain circumstances.
items.version: As Reported by the House Government Accountability and Oversight Committee

items.name: H. B. No. 121
items.shorttitle: Consider water project piping if meets engineering specifications
items.longtitle: To enact section 153.75 of the Revised Code to require a public authority to consider all piping materials that meet the engineering specifications for a state-funded water or waste water project.

items.name: H. B. No. 119
items.shorttitle: Address Nutrition Assistance and Medicaid benefits
items.longtitle: To amend sections 5101.47 and 5101.54 and to enact sections 5162.137 and 5163.04 of the Revised Code regarding eligibility and benefits under the Supplemental Nutrition Assistance program and the Medicaid program.

items.name: H. B. No. 151
items.shorttitle: Restrict firearm transfers; require background checks
items.longtitle: To enact section 2923.26 of the Revised Code to prohibit a transfer of a firearm from a person who is not a federally licensed firearms dealer to a person who is not a federally licensed firearms dealer unless it is done through a federally licensed firearms dealer, through a state or local law enforcement agency, or pursuant to a specified exception; to require that background checks be conducted when a firearm is transferred through a federally licensed firearms dealer or a state or local law enforcement agency; and to provide for recordkeeping with respect to information obtained pursuant to such a background check.

items.name: H. B. No. 153
items.shorttitle: Prohibit imitation firearms
items.longtitle: To enact sections 2923.51, 2923.52, 2923.53, 2923.54, and 2923.55 of the Revised Code to generally ban the manufacture, sale, alteration, and public display of imitation firearms and the disguising of a firearm to make it resemble an imitation firearm.

items.name: H. B. No. 120
items.shorttitle: Changes in Precious Metal Dealers Law
items.longtitle: To amend sections 1321.20, 4727.04, 4728.01, 4728.02, 4728.03, 4728.04, 4728.05, 4728.06, 4728.07, 4728.08, 4728.09, 4728.10, 4728.11, 4728.12, 4728.13, 4728.14, and 4728.99 and to enact sections 4728.061, 4728.062, 4728.16, 4728.17, 4728.18, and 4728.19 of the Revised Code to make changes to the licensing and records requirements, exemptions, penalties, and other provisions of the Precious Metal Dealers Law.

items.name: H. B. No. 130
items.shorttitle: Provide oil or gas well royalty statement with payment
items.longtitle: To amend sections 1509.30 and 1509.99 of the Revised Code to require the owner of an oil or gas well to provide a royalty statement to the holder of the royalty interest when the owner makes payment to the holder.

items.name: H. B. No. 152
items.shorttitle: Require hunting license to specify if firearm restricted
items.longtitle: To amend section 1533.13 of the Revised Code to require an applicant for a hunting license to specify whether the applicant has been convicted of or pleaded guilty to a felony and to require the license to specify "firearm restricted" if an applicant has so indicated.

items.name: S. B. No. 2
items.shorttitle: Revise environmental protection laws

items.name: H. B. No. 180
items.shorttitle: Eliminate sex-based disparities in pay
items.longtitle: To amend section 4117.08 and to enact sections 9.78, 9.781, 9.782, 9.783, 9.784, 9.785, 9.786, 9.787, 9.788, 142.01, 142.02, 142.03, 142.04, 142.05, 142.06, 142.07, 142.08, 142.09, 142.10, 4113.42, and 4117.141 of the Revised Code to require a contractor or person submitting a bid or other proposal for a state contract or a business entity applying for a grant or other economic incentive from a state agency to obtain an equal pay certificate, to require state agencies and political subdivisions to establish a job evaluation system to identify and eliminate sex-based wage disparities among classes of employees, and to prohibit an employer from retaliating against an employee who discusses the employee's salary or wage rate with another employee.

items.name: S. B. No. 87
items.shorttitle: Prohibit noncontractual dental fee insurance schedules
items.longtitle: To amend sections 1753.09, 3901.21, 3963.01, 3963.02, and 3963.03 of the Revised Code to prohibit a health insurer from establishing a fee schedule for dental providers for services that are not covered by any contract or participating provider agreement between the health insurer and the dental provider.

items.name: S. B. No. 71
items.shorttitle: Allow director of ADAMHS board to execute contracts
items.longtitle: To amend the versions of sections 340.03 and 340.041 of the Revised Code scheduled to take effect on July 1, 2017, to allow a board of alcohol, drug addiction, and mental health services to authorize its executive director to execute contracts valued at $50,000 or less without the board's prior approval.

items.name: S. B. No. 80
items.shorttitle: Establish requirements for Nutritional Assistance benefit cards
items.longtitle: To amend sections 5101.33 and 5101.542 and to enact section 5101.331 of the Revised Code to establish requirements for electronic benefit transfer cards issued under the Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program.

items.name: S. B. No. 44
items.shorttitle: Allow electronic filing of campaign finance statements
items.longtitle: To amend sections 3517.10, 3517.105, 3517.106, 3517.1011, and 3517.11 of the Revised Code to allow certain campaign committees and other entities to file campaign finance statements electronically and to require the Secretary of State to make the information in those electronic statements available online.

items.name: S. B. No. 10
items.shorttitle: Eliminate certain primary elections
items.longtitle: To amend sections 102.02, 3513.02, 3513.30, 3513.301, and 3513.312 of the Revised Code to expand the circumstances under which a board of elections or the secretary of state is not required to hold a primary election.

items.name: H. B. No. 80
items.shorttitle: Provide food service for school summer intervention services
items.longtitle: To amend section 3313.813 of the Revised Code to require school districts to allow approved summer food service program sponsors to use school facilities to provide food service for summer intervention services under certain conditions.

items.name: S. B. No. 95
items.shorttitle: Consider all piping material meeting engineering specifications
items.longtitle: To enact section 153.75 of the Revised Code to require a public authority to consider all piping materials that meet the engineering specifications for a state-funded water or waste water project.

items.name: H. B. No. 84
items.shorttitle: Designate June as Ohio Goes Boating Month
items.longtitle: To enact section 5.47 of the Revised Code to designate June as "Ohio Goes Boating Month."

items.name: S. B. No. 88
items.shorttitle: Modify financial planning and supervision commission laws
items.longtitle: To amend sections 118.05, 118.06, 118.11, 118.12, 118.13, and 118.99 and to repeal the version of section 118.023 of the Revised Code that is scheduled to take effect September 29, 2017, to modify the composition and powers of the financial planning and supervision commission of a political subdivision that is in a state of fiscal emergency and to clarify the duties of that political subdivision.
items.version: As Reported by the Senate Government Oversight and Reform Committee

items.name: S. B. No. 33
items.shorttitle: Disclose law enforcement data to defendant
items.longtitle: To amend sections 2913.04 and 2923.129 and to enact section 5503.101 of the Revised Code to allow disclosure of information from the law enforcement automated data system (LEADS) to a defendant in a traffic or criminal case.
items.version: As Reported by the Senate Judiciary Committee

items.name: S. B. No. 20
items.shorttitle: Add prison term if permanently disable victim
items.longtitle: To amend sections 2903.11, 2919.22, 2929.01, 2929.13, and 2929.14 and to enact section 2941.1425 of the Revised Code to require an additional prison term of 3 to 8 years for an offender who is convicted in specified circumstances of a felony offense of endangering children or felonious assault of a child if the offender also is convicted of a specification that the victim suffered permanent disabling harm and to name the act "Destiny's Law."
items.version: As Reported by the Senate Judiciary Committee

items.name: H. B. No. 73
items.shorttitle: Prohibit selling dextromethorphan without Rx if under 18
items.longtitle: To enact section 2925.62 of the Revised Code to prohibit sales of dextromethorphan without a prescription to persons under age 18.

items.name: H. B. No. 114
items.shorttitle: Revise energy efficiency provisions
items.longtitle: To amend sections 4928.01, 4928.142, 4928.143, 4928.20, 4928.61, 4928.62, 4928.64, 4928.641, 4928.643, 4928.644, 4928.645, 4928.65, 4928.66, 4928.662, 4928.6610, 4928.6611, and 5727.75 and to enact sections 4928.647, 4928.664, 4928.665, 4928.666, 4928.667, 4928.6620, and 4928.6621 of the Revised Code and to amend Section 257.80 of Am. Sub. H.B. 64 of the 132nd General Assembly and to repeal Sections 5, 6, 7, 8, 9, 10, and 11 of Sub. S.B. 310 of the 130th General Assembly to revise the provisions governing renewable energy, energy efficiency, and peak demand reduction and to alter funding allocations under the Home Energy Assistance Program.

items.name: H. B. No. 49
items.shorttitle: Creates FY 2018-2019 operating budget
items.local_impact_statement: No - Not required for budget bills

items.name: S. B. No. 1
items.shorttitle: Revise drug laws
items.longtitle: To amend sections 2925.01, 2925.02, 2925.03, 2925.04, 2925.05, 2925.11, 2925.13, 2925.36, 2929.01, 2929.13, 2929.14, 2941.1410, 3719.41, 3719.99, and 4729.99 of the Revised Code to increase penalties for drug trafficking violations, drug possession violations, and aggravated funding of drug trafficking when the drug involved in the offense is a fentanyl-related compound, except for drug possession violations when the fentanyl-related compound is combined with marihuana or a Schedule III, IV, or V controlled substance and the total amount of the combination drug is less than 40 unit doses or 4 grams and the offender did not know of the fentanyl content; to revise the manner of determining sentence for certain violations of the offense of permitting drug abuse; and to add lisdexamfetamine to the list of schedule II controlled substances.
items.version: As Reported by the Senate Judiciary Committee

items.name: H. B. No. 148
items.shorttitle: Register home improvement contractors
items.longtitle: To amend sections 109.572, 715.27, 3781.102, 4740.01, 4776.01, and 4776.20 and to enact sections 4785.01, 4785.02, 4785.021, 4785.03, 4785.04, 4785.05, 4785.06, 4785.07, 4785.08, 4785.09, 4785.11, 4785.12, 4785.13, 4785.14, 4785.15, 4785.16, 4785.17, 4785.18, 4785.19, 4785.20, 4785.21, and 4785.99 of the Revised Code to require statewide registration of home improvement contractors, to create the Home Improvement Board, and to make an appropriation.

items.name: S. B. No. 85
items.shorttitle: Create the Opportunity Scholarship Program

items.name: H. B. No. 100
items.shorttitle: Designate Officer Bill Johnson Memorial Highway
items.longtitle: To enact section 5534.93 of the Revised Code to designate a portion of State Route 73 in Warren County as the "Officer Bill Johnson Memorial Highway."

items.name: H. B. No. 88
items.shorttitle: Create Cuyahoga Valley Career Center license plate
items.longtitle: To amend section 4501.21 and to enact section 4503.905 of the Revised Code to create the "Cuyahoga Valley Career Center" license plate.
items.version: As Reported by the House Transportation and Public Safety Committee

items.name: S. B. No. 39
items.shorttitle: Address community school operations
items.longtitle: To amend sections 3302.01, 3302.03, 3302.41, 3314.03, 3314.032, 3314.08, 3314.23, 3314.27, and 3314.271 and to enact sections 3302.038, 3314.088, 3314.241, 3314.242, and 3314.52 of the Revised Code regarding community school operator contracts, the operation of Internet- and computer-based community schools, and performance metrics for blended learning schools.

items.name: H. B. No. 87
items.shorttitle: Address money returned to state from community school audit
items.longtitle: To enact section 3314.52 of the Revised Code regarding public moneys returned to the state as a result of a finding for recovery issued pursuant to an audit of a community school.

items.name: H. B. No. 47
items.shorttitle: Enact Students to Soldiers Support Act
items.longtitle: To amend sections 3314.03, 3326.11, and 3328.24 and to enact sections 3313.5315 and 3345.425 of the Revised Code to enact the "Students to Soldiers Support Act (S3A)" regarding the participation of students who are serving in the uniformed services in extracurricular activities at public and nonpublic schools and public and private colleges.

items.name: H. B. No. 111
items.shorttitle: Authorize nurses to compel mental health evaluations
items.longtitle: To amend sections 5122.01 and 5122.10 of the Revised Code to authorize certain advanced practice registered nurses to have a person involuntarily transported to a hospital for a mental health examination.
items.version: As Reported by the House Health Committee

items.name: H. B. No. 9
items.shorttitle: Limit scope of protocol for malfunctioning traffic signals
items.longtitle: To amend section 4511.132 of the Revised Code to specify that the alternative protocol for proceeding into an intersection with malfunctioning traffic lights due to a failure of a vehicle detector applies only to bicycles, and to declare an emergency.

items.name: H. B. No. 138
items.shorttitle: Enable anonymous reports of wage discrimination
items.longtitle: To enact section 4112.041 of the Revised Code to require the Ohio Civil Rights Commission to establish a system for individuals to make anonymous complaints regarding employers discriminating in the payment of wages.

items.name: H. B. No. 26
items.shorttitle: Creates FY 2018-2019 transportation budget
items.version: As Reported by Committee of Conference
items.local_impact_statement: No - Not required for budget bills

S.B. 310 of the 130th General Assembly to revise the provisions governing renewable energy, energy efficiency, and peak demand reduction and to alter funding allocations under the Home Energy Assistance Program.

items.shorttitle: Prohibit selling dextromethorphan without Rx if under 18
items.longtitle: To enact section 2925.62 of the Revised Code to prohibit sales of dextromethorphan without a prescription to persons under age 18.

items.name: H. B. No. 44
