items.longtitle: To enact section 5.261 of the Revised Code to designate May 24 as First Responders' Appreciation Day.
items.version: As Reported by the House State and Local Government Committee

items.name: H. B. No. 84
items.shorttitle: Designate June as Ohio Goes Boating Month
items.longtitle: To enact section 5.47 of the Revised Code to designate June as "Ohio Goes Boating Month."
items.version: As Reported by the House State and Local Government Committee

items.name: S. B. No. 9
items.shorttitle: Provide sales tax holiday
items.longtitle: To provide for a three-day sales tax "holiday" in August 2017 during which sales of clothing and school supplies are exempt from sales and use taxes.

items.name: H. B. No. 18
items.shorttitle: Eliminate certain elections to fill Congressional vacancies
items.longtitle: To amend sections 3513.301 and 3513.312 of the Revised Code to eliminate the requirement of holding a special election to fill a vacancy in a party nomination for the office of representative to Congress under certain circumstances.

items.name: H. B. No. 94
items.shorttitle: Designate Teen Dating Violence Awareness Month
items.longtitle: To enact section 5.2516 of the Revised Code to designate February as "Teen Dating Violence Awareness Month."

items.name: H. B. No. 111
items.shorttitle: Authorize nurses to compel mental health evaluations
items.longtitle: To amend sections 5122.01 and 5122.10 of the Revised Code to authorize certain advanced practice registered nurses to have a person involuntarily transported to a hospital for a mental health examination.

items.name: H. B. No. 9
items.shorttitle: Limit scope of protocol for malfunctioning traffic signals
items.longtitle: To amend section 4511.132 of the Revised Code to specify that the alternative protocol for proceeding into an intersection with malfunctioning traffic lights due to a failure of a vehicle detector applies only to bicycles, and to declare an emergency.
items.version: As Reported by the Senate Local Government, Public Safety and Veterans Affairs Committee

items.name: H. B. No. 32
items.shorttitle: Apply criminal penalties to casinos and affiliated casinos
items.longtitle: To amend section 3772.99 of the Revised Code to specify that the criminal penalty related to casino operators and employees participating in casino gaming applies at their casino facility or an affiliated casino facility.

items.name: S. B. No. 62
items.shorttitle: Designate Harrison Dillard Day
items.longtitle: To enact section 5.236 of the Revised Code to designate July 8 as "Harrison Dillard Day."

items.name: S. B. No. 88
items.shorttitle: Modify financial planning and supervision commission laws
items.longtitle: To amend sections 118.05, 118.06, 118.11, 118.12, 118.13, and 118.99 and to repeal the version of section 118.023 of the Revised Code that is scheduled to take effect September 29, 2017, to modify the composition and powers of the financial planning and supervision commission of a political subdivision that is in a state of fiscal emergency and to clarify the duties of that political subdivision.

items.name: S. B. No. 51
items.shorttitle: Facilitate Lake Erie shoreline improvement
items.longtitle: To amend sections 1710.01 and 1710.02 of the Revised Code to authorize the creation of a special improvement district to facilitate Lake Erie shoreline improvement.

items.name: H. B. No. 103
items.shorttitle: Modify financial planning and supervision commission laws
items.longtitle: To amend sections 118.05, 118.06, 118.11, 118.12, 118.13, and 118.99 and to repeal the version of section 118.023 of the Revised Code that is scheduled to take effect September 29, 2017, to modify the composition and powers of the financial planning and supervision commission of a political subdivision that is in a state of fiscal emergency and to clarify the duties of that political subdivision.

items.name: H. B. No. 60
items.shorttitle: Enhanced IDs to facilitate crossing into Canada and Mexico
items.longtitle: To amend sections 4506.01, 4506.11, 4507.01, 4507.13, and 4507.52 and to enact sections 4506.072, 4507.021, 4507.061, and 4507.511 of the Revised Code to authorize the issuance of an enhanced driver's license, enhanced commercial driver's license, and enhanced identification card to facilitate land and sea border crossings between the United States and Canada and Mexico, pursuant to an agreement with the United States Department of Homeland Security.

items.name: H. B. No. 67
items.shorttitle: Prohibit confessions of judgment except as settlement
items.longtitle: To amend sections 1337.53, 2323.12, and 2323.13 and to repeal sections 1907.09 and 2323.14 of the Revised Code to prohibit a person from obtaining a confession of judgment from another person except in connection with the settlement of a dispute.

items.name: H. B. No. 96
items.shorttitle: Increase penalty for sexual imposition
items.longtitle: To amend sections 2907.06, 2929.24, and 2929.41 of the Revised Code to increase the penalty for sexual imposition when the offender previously has been convicted or pleaded guilty three or more times of any of several specified sex offenses and to repeal the corroboration requirement for a sexual imposition conviction.

items.name: H. B. No. 117
items.shorttitle: Establish opioid antagonist therapy for supervised offenders
items.longtitle: To amend sections 2929.16 and 2929.26 and to enact sections 341.43, 753.34, and 5145.33 of the Revised Code to establish a statewide pilot program for the provision of long-acting opioid antagonist therapy for offenders convicted of an opioid-related offense who will be released from confinement on supervised release, and to specify that the therapy is to be provided during both their confinement and their supervised release.

items.name: S. B. No. 91
items.shorttitle: Provide universal health care coverage to Ohioans
items.longtitle: To amend section 109.02 and to enact sections 3920.01, 3920.02, 3920.03, 3920.04, 3920.05, 3920.06, 3920.07, 3920.08, 3920.09, 3920.10, 3920.11, 3920.12, 3920.13, 3920.14, 3920.15, 3920.21, 3920.22, 3920.23, 3920.24, 3920.25, 3920.26, 3920.27, 3920.28, 3920.31, 3920.32, and 3920.33 of the Revised Code to establish and operate the Ohio Health Care Plan to provide universal health care coverage to all Ohio residents.

items.name: S. B. No. 68
items.shorttitle: Prohibit installing unsafe used tires
items.longtitle: To amend section 1345.99 and to enact section 1345.022 of the Revised Code to prohibit the installation of unsafe used tires on certain motor vehicles.

items.name: S. B. No. 92
items.shorttitle: Make failing to display front license plate a secondary offense
items.longtitle: To amend sections 4503.21 and 4511.043 of the Revised Code to specify that failure to display a license plate on the front of a motor vehicle that is required to display a front license plate is a secondary traffic offense, to establish a maximum fine of $25 for such an offense, and to name this act the "DuBose Was A Beacon Act."

items.name: S. B. No. 93
items.shorttitle: Require health insurers to offer hearing aid coverage
items.longtitle: To amend section 1739.05 and to enact sections 1751.76 and 3923.86 of the Revised Code to require health insurers to offer coverage for hearing aids.

items.name: H. B. No. 129
items.shorttitle: Require Governor to complete on-site work experience in schools
items.longtitle: To require the Governor to complete a forty-hour externship consisting of on-site work experience in city, local, and exempted village school districts in the 2017-2018 and 2018-2019 school years.

items.name: S. B. No. 59
items.shorttitle: Require bicyclists and passengers to wear helmets if under 18
items.longtitle: To enact section 4511.531 of the Revised Code to require bicycle operators and passengers under 18 years of age to wear protective helmets when the bicycle is operated on a roadway and to establish the Bicycle Safety Fund to be used by the Department of Public Safety to assist low-income families in the purchase of bicycle helmets.

items.name: S. B. No. 29
items.shorttitle: Enact new banking law

items.name: H. B. No. 110
items.shorttitle: Expand College Credit Plus to include apprenticeships
items.longtitle: To enact section 3365.16 of the Revised Code to create a subprogram of the College Credit Plus Program that permits students to participate in certified apprenticeship programs.

items.name: S. B. No. 82
items.shorttitle: Call parents if student absent from school without excuse
items.longtitle: To amend sections 3313.205, 3314.03, 3326.11, and 3328.24 and to enact section 3321.141 of the Revised Code to require a public school to place a telephone call within one hour of the start of the school day to a parent whose child is absent without legitimate excuse.

items.name: S. B. No. 23
items.shorttitle: Designate an awareness day
items.longtitle: To enact section 5.2510 of the Revised Code to designate January 31 as "Omphalocele Awareness Day."

items.name: H. B. No. 108
items.shorttitle: Include financial literacy in high school curriculum
items.longtitle: To amend sections 3301.079 and 3313.603 and to enact section 3333.89 of the Revised Code to require one-half unit of financial literacy in the high school curriculum, to require the Chancellor of Higher Education to prepare an informed student document for each institution of higher education, to require the State Board of Education to include information on the informed student document in the standards and model curricula it creates for financial literacy and entrepreneurship, and to entitle the act the "Informed Student Document Act."

items.name: H. B. No. 54
items.shorttitle: Issue state revenue bonds to finance acquisition of improvements
items.longtitle: To enact sections 158.01, 158.02, 158.03, 158.04, 158.05, 158.06, 158.07, 158.08, 158.09, 158.10, and 158.11 of the Revised Code to authorize the Treasurer of State to issue revenue obligations of the state for the purpose of making loans to qualifying public entities for their acquisition of permanent improvements through the Treasurer of State's purchase of public obligations of those qualifying entities.

items.name: H. B. No. 98
items.shorttitle: Address career information presentations to students
items.longtitle: To amend section 3313.471 of the Revised Code regarding the presentation of career information to students.

items.name: S. B. No. 104
items.shorttitle: Prohibit use of seclusion on school pupils
items.longtitle: To amend section 3319.46 of the Revised Code to prohibit the use of seclusion on students in public schools.

items.name: H. B. No. 39
items.shorttitle: Require removal of snow and ice from abutting sidewalks
items.longtitle: To enact section 505.872 of the Revised Code to authorize certain townships to require the removal of snow and ice from sidewalks abutting property.
items.version: As Reported by the House State and Local Government Committee

items.name: H. B. No. 107
items.shorttitle: Require two-person crews on freight trains
items.longtitle: To enact section 4999.09 of the Revised Code to require the crews of freight trains to consist of at least two individuals.

items.name: S. B. No. 81
items.shorttitle: Revise licensing rules for military personnel concealed carry
items.longtitle: To amend section 2923.125 of the Revised Code to waive the concealed carry license fee for active members of the armed forces and retired and honorably discharged veterans, to accept military experience with firearms as proof of competency with firearms regardless of when the applicant for a license acquired the experience,  to permit a licensee to renew a concealed handgun license at any time before the expiration of the license, and to require the Attorney General to monitor the number of license fees waived and cap the total amount allowed to be waived at $1.5 million.

items.name: S. B. No. 69
items.shorttitle: Designate June as Ohio Goes Boating Month
items.longtitle: To enact section 5.47 of the Revised Code to designate June as "Ohio Goes Boating Month."

items.name: S. B. No. 99
items.shorttitle: Prohibit new enrollees in Medicaid expansion group
items.longtitle: To amend sections 5163.01, 5166.40, and 5166.405 and to enact section 5163.15 of the Revised Code to prohibit the Medicaid program from newly enrolling individuals as part of the expansion eligibility group.

items.name: S. B. No. 83
items.shorttitle: Establish duties for Attorney General if person killed by police
items.longtitle: To enact section 109.021 of the Revised Code to establish the duties and authority of the Attorney General to investigate and prosecute cases relating to the death of a person caused by a peace officer.

items.name: S. B. No. 32
items.shorttitle: Narrow scope of speedy trial rules
items.longtitle: To amend sections 2945.71 and 2945.73 of the Revised Code to provide a prosecutor an additional fourteen days to commence a trial after a person charged with a felony has been discharged because the person has not been brought to trial within the required amount of time and to authorize the court to release the person from detention in connection with those charges pending trial.

items.name: H. B. No. 26
items.shorttitle: Creates FY 2018-2019 transportation budget
items.version: As Reported by the Senate Transportation, Commerce and Workforce Committee
items.local_impact_statement: No - Not required for budget bills

items.name: H. B. No. 26
items.shorttitle: Creates FY 2018-2019 transportation budget
items.local_impact_statement: No - Not required for budget bills

items.name: S. B. No. 37
items.shorttitle: Develop and conduct training for new police chiefs
items.longtitle: To amend sections 505.49, 737.052, and 737.15 and to enact section 109.804 of the Revised Code to require the Ohio Peace Officer Training Commission to develop and conduct a chief of police training course for newly appointed village, city, and township chiefs of police.
items.version: As Reported by the Senate Local Government, Public Safety and Veterans Affairs Committee

items.name: H. B. No. 100

items.longtitle: To enact section 5534.93 of the Revised Code to designate a portion of State Route 73 in Warren County as the "Officer Bill Johnson Memorial Highway."

items.name: S. B. No. 6

items.shorttitle: Provide sales tax holiday for Energy Star product purchases
items.longtitle: To amend sections 5739.02 and 5739.05 of the Revised Code to provide a three-day sales tax "holiday" each April during which sales of qualifying Energy Star products are exempt from sales and use taxes.

items.name: S. B. No. 35
items.shorttitle: Enhance earned income tax credit
items.longtitle: To amend sections 5747.71 and 5747.98 of the Revised Code to remove the income restriction on the earned income tax credit and to make the credit refundable beginning in 2017.

items.name: H. B. No. 123
items.shorttitle: Modify short-term, small, and mortgage loan laws
items.longtitle: To amend sections 1321.35, 1321.36, 1321.39, 1321.40, 1321.41, 1321.422, 1321.99, and 4712.99, to enact new section 1321.46 and sections 1321.141, 1321.401, 1321.402, 1321.403, 1321.411, 1321.595, and 4712.071, and to repeal sections 1321.46 and 1321.461 of the Revised Code to modify the Short-Term Loan Act, to specify a minimum duration requirement for loans made under the Small Loan Law and Mortgage Loan Law, and to limit the authority of credit services organizations to broker extensions of credit for buyers.

items.name: S. B. No. 66
items.shorttitle: Modify criminal sentencing and corrections law
items.longtitle: To amend sections 2929.11, 2929.13, 2929.15, 2929.16, 2929.19, 2951.041, 2953.31, 2967.16, and 2967.28 of the Revised Code to modify criminal sentencing and corrections law by including rehabilitation as a purpose of felony sentencing, removing the one-year minimum for presumptive fourth or fifth degree felony community control sanctions, modifying sanctions for a violation of a community control condition, modifying the manner of calculating confinement credits, modifying eligibility criteria and procedures for granting intervention in lieu of conviction, making offenders convicted of certain multiple fourth or fifth degree felonies eligible for conviction record sealing, revising procedures for the Adult Parole Authority to grant a final release or terminate post-release control, and modifying the criteria for considering a prison term sanction for a post-release control violation.

items.name: S. B. No. 55
items.shorttitle: Specify rights of nurses
items.longtitle: To amend sections 3727.50, 3727.51, 3727.52, and 3727.53 and to enact sections 3727.80 to 3727.88 of the Revised Code to establish minimum ratios of direct-care registered nurses to patients in hospitals, to specify rights of registered nurses working in hospitals, and to prohibit retaliatory actions by hospitals against registered nurses.

items.name: H. B. No. 97
items.shorttitle: Remove spousal exceptions for certain sex offenses
items.longtitle: To amend sections 2907.02, 2907.03, 2907.04, 2907.05, 2907.06, 2907.07, 2907.09, and 2945.42 of the Revised Code to eliminate the spousal exceptions for the offenses of rape, sexual battery, unlawful sexual conduct with a minor, gross sexual imposition, sexual imposition, importuning, and public indecency and to permit a person to testify against the person's spouse in a prosecution for any of those offenses.

items.name: H. B. No. 57
items.shorttitle: Require use of domestic steel in school and college buildings
items.longtitle: To amend sections 3314.03, 3326.11, and 3328.24 and to enact sections 3313.461, 3345.90, and 3781.181 of the Revised Code to require the use of domestic steel in construction, repair, or improvement projects involving certain buildings used by public schools, state institutions of higher education, and specified private colleges.

items.name: S. B. No. 60
items.shorttitle: Regulate drones used by law enforcement officers
items.longtitle: To enact sections 2933.67, 2933.68, 2933.69, and 2933.70 of the Revised Code to regulate the use of drones for gathering evidence and information by law enforcement officers in Ohio.

items.name: H. B. No. 59
items.shorttitle: Designate Moses Fleetwood Walker Day
items.longtitle: To enact section 5.242 of the Revised Code to designate October 7 as "Moses Fleetwood Walker Day."

items.name: S. B. No. 98
items.shorttitle: Establish licensing of dental therapists

items.name: S. B. No. 84
items.shorttitle: Prevent biased policing and status profiling
items.longtitle: To amend sections 109.73, 109.77, 109.79, 109.80, and 5503.05 and to enact sections 109.748, 109.749, and 2933.84 of the Revised Code to require the Ohio Peace Officer Training Commission to develop a course to train peace officers in performing their duties without biased policing or status-based profiling; to prohibit law enforcement officers and officials from engaging in biased policing or status-based profiling; to require each law enforcement agency to develop and provide annually to its officers an educational training program on how to perform law enforcement duties without engaging in biased policing or status-based profiling; to create the racial and identity profiling advisory board; to provide a civil cause of action for an individual who is a victim of biased policing or status-based profiling; and to permit the Attorney General to seek injunctive relief against a law enforcement agency served by an officer who commits biased policing or status-based profiling.

items.name: S. B. No. 23
items.shorttitle: Designate an awareness day
items.longtitle: To enact section 5.2510 of the Revised Code to designate January 31 as "Omphalocele Awareness Day."

items.name: S. B. No. 43
items.shorttitle: Enable limited home rule townships to adopt building codes
items.longtitle: To amend sections 504.04 and 504.13 of the Revised Code to enable limited home rule townships to adopt building codes regardless of any similar codes adopted by the county in which the township resides.

items.name: H. B. No. 76
items.shorttitle: Create Ohio Cross and Ottawa Wildlife Refuge license plates
items.longtitle: To amend section 4501.21 and to enact sections 4503.436 and 4503.566 of the Revised Code to create the "Ohio National Guard Ohio Cross" license plate and the "Ottawa National Wildlife Refuge" license plate.

items.longtitle: To amend sections 505.49, 737.052, and 737.15 and to enact section 109.804 of the Revised Code to require the Ohio Peace Officer Training Commission to develop and conduct a chief of police training course for newly appointed village, city, and township chiefs of police.

items.name: S. B. No. 100
items.shorttitle: Expand civil rights and related procedures
items.longtitle: To amend sections 9.03, 124.93, 125.111, 153.59, 153.591, 340.12, 511.03, 717.01, 1501.012, 1751.18, 2927.03, 3113.36, 3301.53, 3304.15, 3304.50, 3314.06, 3332.09, 3721.13, 3905.55, 4111.17, 4112.01, 4112.02, 4112.021, 4112.024, 4112.04, 4112.05, 4112.08, 4117.19, 4735.16, 4735.55, 4757.07, 4758.16, 4765.18, 5104.09, 5107.26, 5123.351, 5126.07, 5165.08, 5515.08, and 5709.832 of the Revised Code to prohibit discrimination on the basis of sexual orientation or gender identity or expression, to add mediation to the list of informal methods by which the Ohio Civil Rights Commission must attempt to induce compliance with Ohio's Civil Rights Law before instituting a formal hearing, and to eliminate certain religious exemptions from the Ohio Civil Rights Law.

items.name: S. B. No. 24
items.shorttitle: Enact Consumer Installment Loan Act

items.name: S. B. No. 27
items.shorttitle: Designate a commemorative month
items.longtitle: To amend section 5.2281 of the Revised Code to designate the period beginning March 13 and ending April 15 as "Ohio Deaf History Month."

items.name: S. B. No. 18
items.shorttitle: Designate a commemorative day
items.longtitle: To enact section 5.291 of the Revised Code to designate September 12 as "Jesse Owens Day."

items.name: H. B. No. 1
items.shorttitle: Authorize dating violence protection orders
items.longtitle: To amend sections 109.42, 2151.34, 2903.214, 2919.26, 2919.27, 3113.31, and 3113.33 and to enact section 3113.311 of the Revised Code to authorize the issuance of dating violence protection orders with respect to conduct directed at a petitioner alleging dating violence, to provide access to domestic violence shelters for victims of dating violence, and to require the Attorney General's victim's bill of rights pamphlet to include a notice that a petitioner alleging dating violence has the right to petition for a civil protection order.
items.version: As Reported by the House Civil Justice Committee

items.name: H. B. No. 34
items.shorttitle: Deliver notices by ordinary mail or electronically
items.longtitle: To amend sections 9.312, 124.327, 128.07, 149.30, 303.14, 307.204, 307.699, 340.02, 343.01, 505.109, 505.266, 505.391, 505.511, 519.14, 902.04, 931.03, 940.20, 3517.01, 3517.11, 3791.12, 4301.39, 5713.082, 5715.12, 5715.19, 5715.20, 5717.01, 5721.30, 5721.31, 5721.32, 5721.33, and 5727.75 of the Revised Code to authorize certain state agencies, local governments, and other boards, commissions, and officers to deliver certain notices by ordinary mail and electronically instead of by certified mail.
items.version: As Reported by the House State and Local Government Committee

items.name: H. B. No. 5
items.shorttitle: Define "microbusiness."
items.longtitle: To enact section 166.50 of the Revised Code to create a statutory definition of "microbusiness."
items.version: As Reported by the House State and Local Government Committee

items.name: H. B. No. 31
items.shorttitle: Abolish Government Contracting Advisory Council
items.longtitle: To amend section 9.23 and to repeal section 9.239 of the Revised Code to abolish the Government Contracting Advisory Council.

items.version: As Reported by the House Finance Committee

items.shorttitle: Deliver notices by ordinary mail or electronically
items.longtitle: To amend sections 9.312, 124.327, 128.07, 149.30, 303.14, 307.204, 307.699, 340.02, 343.01, 505.109, 505.391, 505.511, 902.04, 931.03, 940.20, 3517.01, 3517.11, 3791.12, 4301.39, 5713.082, 5715.12, 5715.19, 5715.20, 5717.01, 5721.30, 5721.31, 5721.32, 5721.33, and 5727.75 of the Revised Code to authorize certain state agencies, local governments, and other boards, commissions, and officers to deliver certain notices by ordinary mail and electronically instead of by certified mail.

items.name: H. B. No. 42
items.shorttitle: Prohibit installation of unsafe used tires
items.longtitle: To amend section 1345.99 and to enact section 1345.022 of the Revised Code to prohibit the installation of unsafe used tires on certain motor vehicles.

items.name: S. B. No. 37
items.shorttitle: Develop and conduct training for new police chiefs
items.longtitle: To amend sections 505.49, 737.052, and 737.15 and to enact section 109.804 of the Revised Code to require the Ohio Peace Officer Training Commission to develop and conduct a chief of police training course for newly appointed village, city, and township chiefs of police.

items.name: S. B. No. 42
items.shorttitle: Specify that referring to a drug also refers to compounds
items.longtitle: To amend sections 2925.02, 2925.03, 2925.04, 2925.05, 2925.11, 2925.12, 2925.14, 2925.141, 2925.22, 2925.23, 2925.36, 2925.51, 2929.14, 3719.99, and 4729.99 of the Revised Code to expressly provide that drug offense penalties that refer to a particular type of drug also apply to a compound, mixture, preparation, or substance containing a detectable amount of that drug and to declare an emergency.

items.name: S. B. No. 40
items.shorttitle: Avoid death penalty if serious mental illness at time of crime
items.longtitle: To amend sections 2929.02, 2929.022, 2929.024, 2929.03, 2929.04, 2929.06, 2953.21, and 2953.23 and to enact section 2929.025 of the Revised Code to provide that a person convicted of aggravated murder who shows that the person had a serious mental illness at the time of committing the offense cannot be sentenced to death for the offense and to provide a mechanism for resentencing to a life sentence a person previously sentenced to death who proves that the person had a serious mental illness at the time of committing the offense.

items.name: S. B. No. 44
items.shorttitle: Allow electronic filing of campaign finance statements
items.longtitle: To amend sections 3517.10, 3517.105, 3517.106, 3517.1011, and 3517.11 of the Revised Code to allow certain campaign committees and other entities to file campaign finance statements electronically and to require the Secretary of State to make the information in those electronic statements available online.

items.name: S. B. No. 31
items.shorttitle: Withdraw from state household sewage system rules
items.longtitle: To enact section 3718.026 of the Revised Code to authorize a board of county commissioners or municipal legislative authority to elect to withdraw the county or municipal corporation from the application of any rule adopted by the Department of Health after January 1, 2014, that governs the design of household sewage treatment systems.

items.name: S. B. No. 15
items.shorttitle: Expand minority business set-asides/EDGE procurement
items.longtitle: To amend sections 123.152 and 3358.10 and to enact sections 3354.161, 3355.121, and 3357.161 of the Revised Code to require community colleges, state community colleges, technical colleges, and university branches to comply with minority business enterprise set-aside requirements, and to require the Director of Administrative Services to establish guidelines for these entities, and the Northeast Ohio Medical University, to establish procurement goals for contracting with EDGE business enterprises.

items.name: H. B. No. 26
items.shorttitle: Creates FY 2018-2019 transportation budget
items.local_impact_statement: No - Not required for budget bills

items.longtitle: To provide for a three-day sales tax "holiday" in August 2017 during which sales of clothing and school supplies are exempt from sales and use taxes.

items.name: S. B. No. 46
items.shorttitle: Designate Arnold R Pinkney Memorial Way
items.longtitle: To enact section 5534.60 of the Revised Code to designate portions of United States Route 422 within the municipal corporations of Cleveland and Youngstown as the "Arnold R. Pinkney Memorial Way."

items.name: H. B. No. 55
items.shorttitle: Designate Bret M Poklar Memorial Highway
items.longtitle: To enact section 5534.38 of the Revised Code to designate a portion of State Route Two in Lake County as the "Lcpl Bret M. Poklar Memorial Highway."

items.name: S. B. No. 19
items.shorttitle: Expand prosecutors prohibited from private practice
items.longtitle: To amend sections 309.02 and 325.11 of the Revised Code to prohibit prosecuting attorneys of counties with a population of 400,001 or more from engaging in the private practice of law.

items.name: S. B. No. 61
items.shorttitle: Make appropriations for public transportation
items.longtitle: To make appropriations related to public transportation.

items.name: S. B. No. 53
items.shorttitle: Ban taking oil or gas from bed of Lake Erie
items.longtitle: To amend section 1505.07 of the Revised Code to ban the taking or removal of oil or natural gas from and under the bed of Lake Erie.

items.name: S. B. No. 49
items.shorttitle: Prohibit asking if job applicant has been convicted of a felony
items.longtitle: To enact section 4113.13 of the Revised Code to prohibit private employers from including on an employment application any question concerning whether an applicant has been convicted of or pleaded guilty to a felony.

items.name: S. B. No. 47
items.shorttitle: Prohibit noncompete clauses in broadcasting industry
items.longtitle: To enact section 4113.66 of the Revised Code to prohibit the use of noncompete provisions in employment contracts in the broadcasting industry.

items.name: H. B. No. 53
items.shorttitle: Remove requirements to join public employee union
items.longtitle: To amend sections 9.81, 121.40, 124.14, 124.15, 3345.31, 4117.03, 4117.04, 4117.05, 4117.09, 4117.10, 4117.11, 4121.03, 4121.121, 4121.69, and 5501.20 of the Revised Code to remove any requirement under the Public Employees Collective Bargaining Law that public employees join or pay dues to any employee organization, to prohibit public employers from requiring public employees to join or pay dues to any employee organization, to prohibit an employee organization from being required to represent public employees who are not members of the employee organization, and to make an appropriation.

items.name: S. B. No. 30
items.shorttitle: Regulate traffic on county and township roads
items.longtitle: To enact section 305.50 of the Revised Code to authorize counties to adopt resolutions regulating motor vehicle traffic on county and township roads.

items.name: H. B. No. 39
items.shorttitle: Require removal of snow and ice from abutting sidewalks
items.longtitle: To enact section 505.872 of the Revised Code to authorize certain townships to require the removal of snow and ice from sidewalks abutting property.

items.name: H. B. No. 9
items.shorttitle: Limit scope of protocol for malfunctioning traffic signals
items.longtitle: To amend section 4511.132 of the Revised Code to specify that the alternative protocol for proceeding into an intersection with malfunctioning traffic lights due to a failure of a vehicle detector applies only to bicycles.
items.version: As Reported by the House Transportation and Public Safety Committee

items.name: H. B. No. 22
items.shorttitle: Designate a memorial highway
items.longtitle: To enact section 5534.69 of the Revised Code to designate a portion of State Route 261 in Medina and Summit Counties as the "Sergeant James F. Allen III Memorial Highway."
items.version: As Reported by the House Transportation and Public Safety Committee

items.name: H. B. No. 16
items.shorttitle: Designate a memorial highway
items.longtitle: To enact section 5534.74 of the Revised Code to designate a portion of State Route 43 in Jefferson County as the "Army Corporal Carl H. Bernhart Memorial Highway."
items.version: As Reported by the House Transportation and Public Safety Committee

items.name: S. B. No. 50
items.shorttitle: Prohibit deep well injection of brine and conversion of wells
items.longtitle: To amend sections 1509.01, 1509.02, 1509.03, 1509.05, 1509.06, 1509.08, 1509.21, 1509.22, 1509.222, 1509.223, 1509.224, and 1509.99, to enact section 1509.051, and to repeal section 1509.226 of the Revised Code to to prohibit land application and deep well injection of brine, to prohibit the conversion of wells, and to eliminate the injection fee that is levied under the Oil and Gas Law.

items.name: S. B. No. 38
items.shorttitle: Enhance employee rights
items.longtitle: To amend sections 119.14, 121.083, 1349.61, 4111.02, 4111.03, 4111.09, 4111.13, 4111.14, 4113.15, 4115.03, 4121.01, 4123.01, 4123.026, 4141.01, and 5747.01 and to enact sections 4177.01, 4177.02, 4177.03, 4177.04, 4177.05, 4177.06, 4177.07, 4177.08, 4177.09, 4177.10, 4177.11, 4177.12, 4177.13, 4177.14, 4177.15, 4177.16, 4177.17, 4177.18, and 4177.99 of the Revised Code to raise the minimum wage; to eliminate the prohibition against political subdivisions establishing a different minimum wage; to raise the salary threshold above which certain employees are exempt from the overtime law; and to create a uniform standard to determine whether an individual performing services for an employer is an employee of that employer.

items.name: S. B. No. 23
items.shorttitle: Designate an awareness day
items.longtitle: To enact section 5.2510 of the Revised Code to designate January 31 as "Omphalocele Awareness Day."
items.version: As Reported by the Senate Health, Human Services and Medicaid Committee

items.name: H. B. No. 40
items.shorttitle: Establish State Government Expenditure Database
items.longtitle: To enact sections 113.60, 113.61, 113.62, 113.63, 113.64, 113.65, 113.66, 113.67, 113.68, and 113.69 of the Revised Code to require the Treasurer of State to establish the Ohio State Government Expenditure Database.

items.name: S. B. No. 23
items.shorttitle: Designate an awareness day
items.longtitle: To enact section 5.240 of the Revised Code to designate January 31 as "Omphalocele Awareness Day."

items.shorttitle: Designate barn as historical architectural structure
items.longtitle: To enact section 5.074 of the Revised Code to designate the barn as the official historical architectural structure of the state.

items.longtitle: To enact section 166.50 of the Revised Code to create a statutory definition of "microbusiness."

items.longtitle: To amend sections 109.42, 2151.23, 2919.27, and 3113.33 and to enact section 3113.311 of the Revised Code to authorize the issuance of dating violence protection orders with respect to conduct directed at a petitioner alleging dating violence, to provide access to domestic violence shelters for victims of dating violence, and to require the Attorney General's victim's bill of rights pamphlet to include a notice that a petitioner alleging dating violence has the right to petition for a civil protection order.

items.name: H. B. No. 27
items.shorttitle: Creates FY 2018-2019 Workers' Compensation budget
items.longtitle:
To amend sections 4123.29, 4123.53, 4123.54, 4123.56, 4123.57, 4123.66, 4123.71, 4167.01, 4167.02, and 4167.10 and to repeal sections 4123.72 and 4167.19 of the Revised Code to make changes to the Workers' Compensation Law, to make appropriations for the Bureau of Workers' Compensation for the biennium beginning July 1, 2017, and ending June
30, 2019, and to provide authorization and
conditions for the operation of the Bureau's
programs.
items.local_impact_statement: No - Not required for budget bills

items.name: H. B. No. 6
items.shorttitle: Prohibit fees for correcting criminal record information
items.longtitle: To enact section 2927.22 of the Revised Code to prohibit a person who publishes or disseminates criminal record information from soliciting or accepting a fee to remove, correct, modify, or refrain from publishing or otherwise disseminating the information and to provide criminal and civil remedies for a violation of the prohibition.

items.name: S. B. No. 33
items.shorttitle: Disclose law enforcement data to defendant
items.longtitle: To amend sections 2913.04 and 2923.129 and to enact section 5503.101 of the Revised Code to allow disclosure of information from the law enforcement automated data system (LEADS) to a defendant in a traffic or criminal case.

items.name: H. B. No. 32
items.shorttitle: Apply criminal penalties to casinos and affiliated casinos
items.longtitle: To amend section 3772.99 of the Revised Code to specify that the criminal penalty related to casino operators and employees participating in casino gaming applies at their casino facility or an affiliated casino facility.
items.version: As Reported by the House Criminal Justice Committee

items.name: H. B. No. 11
items.shorttitle: Incorporate Internal Revenue Code changes
items.longtitle: To amend section 5701.11 of the Revised Code to expressly incorporate changes in the Internal Revenue Code since February 14, 2016, into Ohio law.
items.version: As Reported by the House Ways and Means Committee

items.name: H. B. No. 4
items.shorttitle: Prescribe how cocaine is to be measured for offense
items.longtitle: To amend sections 2925.03 and 2925.11 of the Revised Code to provide that in determining the amount of cocaine for trafficking and possession offenses, it also includes a compound, mixture, preparation, or substance containing cocaine, and to declare an emergency.
items.version: As Reported by the House Criminal Justice Committee

items.name: S. B. No. 28
items.shorttitle: Address disposition of aborted fetal remains
items.longtitle: To amend sections 2317.56, 3701.341, and 3701.79 and to enact sections 3726.01, 3726.02, 3726.03, 3726.04, 3726.041, 3726.042, 3726.05, 3726.09, 3726.10, 3726.11, 3726.12, 3726.13, 3726.14, 3726.15, 3726.16, 3726.95, 3726.99, and 4717.271 of the Revised Code regarding final disposition of fetal remains from surgical abortions.

items.name: H. B. No. 9
items.shorttitle: Limit scope of protocol for malfunctioning traffic signals
items.longtitle: To amend section 4511.132 of the Revised Code to specify that the alternative protocol for proceeding into an intersection with malfunctioning traffic lights due to a failure of a vehicle detector applies only to bicycles.

items.name: S. B. No. 25
items.shorttitle: Create new municipal court
items.longtitle: To amend sections 1901.01, 1901.02, 1901.03, 1901.07, 1901.08, 1901.31, 1901.312, 1901.34, and 1907.11 of the Revised Code to create the Perry County Municipal Court in New Lexington on January 1, 2018, to establish one full-time judgeship in that court, to provide for the nomination of the judge by petition only, to abolish the Perry County County Court on that date, to designate the Perry County Clerk of Courts as the clerk of the Perry County Municipal Court, and to provide for the election for the Perry County Municipal Court of one full-time judge in 2017.

items.name: H. B. No. 4
items.shorttitle: Prescribe how cocaine is to be measured for offense
items.longtitle: To amend sections 2925.03 and 2925.11 of the Revised Code to provide that in determining the amount of cocaine for trafficking and possession offenses, it also includes a compound, mixture, preparation, or substance containing cocaine, and to declare an emergency.

items.name: H. B. No. 32
items.shorttitle: Apply criminal penalties to casinos and affiliated casinos
items.longtitle: To amend section 3772.99 of the Revised Code to specify that the criminal penalty related to casino operators and employees participating in casino gaming applies at their casino facility or an affiliated casino facility.

items.name: H. B. No. 11
items.shorttitle: Incorporate Internal Revenue Code changes
items.longtitle: To amend section 5701.11 of the Revised Code to expressly incorporate changes in the Internal Revenue Code since February 14, 2016, into Ohio law.

items.name: S. B. No. 1
items.shorttitle: Revise drug laws
items.longtitle: To amend sections 2925.01, 2925.02, 2925.03,2925.04, 2925.05, 2925.11, 2925.13, 2925.36, 2929.01, 2929.14, 2941.1410, 3719.41, 3719.99, and 4729.99 of the Revised Code to increase penalties for drug trafficking violations, drug possession violations, and aggravated funding of drug trafficking when the drug involved in the offense is a fentanyl-related compound, to revise the manner of determining sentence for certain violations of the offense of permitting drug abuse, and to add lisdexamfetamine to the list of schedule II controlled substances.

items.name: S. B. No. 20
items.shorttitle: Add prison term if permanently disable victim
items.longtitle: To amend sections 2929.01, 2929.13, and 2929.14 and to enact section 2941.1425 of the Revised Code to require an additional prison term of 3 to 8 years for an offender who is convicted of or pleads guilty to a felony offense of violence if the offender is convicted of or pleads guilty to a specification that the victim suffered permanent disabling harm.

items.name: H. B. No. 16
items.shorttitle: Designate a memorial highway
items.longtitle: To enact section 5534.74 of the Revised Code to designate a portion of State Route 43 in Jefferson County as the "Army Corporal Carl H. Bernhart Memorial Highway."

items.name: H. B. No. 22
items.shorttitle: Designate a memorial highway
items.longtitle: To enact section 5534.69 of the Revised Code to designate a portion of State Route 261 in Medina and Summit Counties as the "Sergeant James F. Allen III Memorial Highway."

items.name: S. B. No. 14
items.shorttitle: Address domestic worker pay
items.longtitle: To amend sections 4111.02, 4111.08, 4111.10, 4111.13, 4111.14, 4111.99, 4112.01, and 4112.05 and to enact sections 4111.021, 4111.031, and 4112.025 of the Revised Code to require that domestic workers be paid the higher of the minimum wage provided in Section 34a of Article II, Ohio Constitution, or the minimum wage provided in the Fair Labor Standards Act, to require that domestic workers be paid overtime wages, to make certain conduct directed toward a domestic worker an unlawful discriminatory practice, and to require a weekly day of rest for domestic workers.

items.name: S. B. No. 26
items.shorttitle: Designate a memorial highway
items.longtitle: To enact section 5534.49 of the Revised Code to designate a portion of State Route 205 and United States Route 62 in Knox County as the "Officer Thomas W. Cottrell Jr. Memorial Highway."

items.name: S. B. No. 13
items.shorttitle: Grant right to record law enforcement incident
items.longtitle: To amend sections 2315.18, 2323.43, 2744.02, 2744.03, 2744.04, and 2744.05 and to enact sections 2743.021, 2744.021, and 2744.022 of the Revised Code to grant a person the right to lawfully record any incident involving a law enforcement officer and to impose civil liability upon the state or a local law enforcement agency if a law enforcement officer employed by the state or local law enforcement agency interferes with the recording of the incident, destroys the recording, seizes the recording without a warrant or subpoena or the person's consent, or retaliates against the person who recorded the incident.

items.name: S. B. No. 41
items.shorttitle: Provide testimonial privilege to qualified advocates
items.longtitle: To amend sections 2151.421, 2317.02, and 2921.22 of the Revised Code to provide generally a testimonial privilege for communications between a qualified advocate rendering advocacy services and a victim of sexual violence, menacing by stalking, or domestic violence, to exempt the nondisclosure of that privileged communication from the offense of failure to report a crime, to require a qualified advocate to report knowledge or reasonable suspicion of child abuse or neglect of the victim except for privileged communications, and to specify circumstances in which the victim is considered to have waived the privilege.

items.name: S. B. No. 22
items.shorttitle: Incorporate Internal Revenue Code changes
items.longtitle: To amend section 5701.11 of the Revised Code to expressly incorporate changes in the Internal Revenue Code since February 14, 2016, into Ohio law.
items.version: As Reported by the Senate Ways and Means Committee

items.name: S. B. No. 22
items.shorttitle: Incorporate changes in Internal Revenue Code
items.longtitle: To amend section 5701.11 of the Revised Code to expressly incorporate changes in the Internal Revenue Code since February 14, 2016, into Ohio law.

items.name: S. B. No. 9
items.shorttitle: Provide sales tax holiday
items.longtitle: To provide for a three-day sales tax "holiday" in August 2017 during which sales of clothing and school supplies are exempt from sales and use taxes.

items.name: S. B. No. 12
items.shorttitle: Preclude death penalty if based on race
items.longtitle: To enact section 2929.07 of the Revised Code to provide that a defendant cannot be executed if the defendant's race was the basis of the decision to seek or impose the death penalty, to permit a defendant to file a motion alleging that the defendant's race was the basis of the decision to seek or impose the death penalty, and to specify the procedure for determining if the defendant's race was the basis of that decision.

items.name: S. B. No. 7
items.shorttitle: Know of protection order if actual knowledge
items.longtitle: To amend section 2919.27 of the Revised Code to provide that service of a protection order or consent agreement upon a person is not necessary for the person to be convicted of the offense of violating a protection order if the person had actual notice of the order or agreement and the person recklessly violated its terms.

items.name: S. B. No. 17
items.shorttitle: Increase allocations to Local Government Fund
items.longtitle: To amend section 131.51 of the Revised Code to increase monthly allocations to the Local Government Fund from 1.66% to 3.68% of the total tax revenue credited to the General Revenue Fund each month.
